member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ActionResult
member.summary: Represents the base class for action results in charting operations. This abstract class provides a framework for handling the outcome of chart-related actions and determining whether a visual invalidation is required.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ActionResult.ShouldInvalidate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the chart should be invalidated after this action.
member.value: true if the chart requires visual invalidation to reflect changes; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When set to true, this property signals that the chart needs to be redrawn to properly display the results of the action.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.UI.ActionResult.Execute(System.Object)
member.summary: When implemented in a derived class, executes the action with the specified context.
member.param: The context object containing information necessary for action execution. This can be any object type depending on the specific action implementation.
member.remarks: This method must be implemented by derived classes to define the specific behavior of the action. The context parameter provides the necessary data for the action to complete its operation.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Data.RadCollectionView`1
member.summary: Provides an abstract base class for collection views that support filtering, sorting, grouping, and paging operations on strongly-typed data item collections.
member.typeparam: The type of data items in the collection, which must implement .

remarks.para: RadCollectionView serves as the foundation for data binding scenarios in RadControls, providing a rich set of data manipulation capabilities including filtering, sorting, grouping, and paging. It implements multiple collection interfaces to ensure compatibility with various data binding patterns and frameworks.

The collection view acts as a layer between raw data sources and UI controls, allowing for complex data operations without modifying the underlying data. It supports expression-based filtering, multi-level sorting, hierarchical grouping, and efficient pagination for large datasets.
Key features include change notifications through and , current item tracking, deferred refresh capabilities, and thread-safe operations for multi-threaded environments.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Data.RadListSource`1
member.summary: Provides a data binding source that manages strongly-typed data item collections with full support for Windows Forms data binding, list manipulation, and change notifications.
member.typeparam: The type of data items in the list, which must implement .

remarks.para: RadListSource serves as a comprehensive data binding intermediary that bridges the gap between various data sources and RadControls. It implements multiple Windows Forms data binding interfaces including , , , and change notification interfaces to provide seamless integration with the .NET data binding infrastructure.

The class manages a collection view that provides advanced data manipulation capabilities such as filtering, sorting, grouping, and paging. It maintains currency management for current item tracking and supports transactional operations for add/edit scenarios.

RadListSource can bind to various data sources including collections, DataTables, business objects, and other data sources through the interface. It automatically handles data source changes, property descriptor management, and related data source relationships.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Data.CurrentChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the CurrentChanged event that occurs when the current item in a data collection changes.

remarks.para: CurrentChangedEventArgs is used in data binding scenarios to provide information about why the current item position changed within a collection. This is essential for tracking navigation events in data-bound controls.
The Reason property indicates whether the change was due to user navigation, programmatic changes, data refresh, or other collection manipulation operations.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Data.CurrentChangedEventArgs.#ctor(Telerik.WinControls.CurrentChangeReason)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified reason for the change.
member.param: A value indicating why the current item changed.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Data.CurrentChangedEventArgs.Reason
member.summary: Gets the reason why the current item in the collection changed.
member.value: A value indicating the cause of the current item change.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Data.CurrentChangingEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the CurrentChanging event that occurs before the current item in a data collection changes.

remarks.para: CurrentChangingEventArgs extends CancelEventArgs to allow cancellation of the current item change operation. This is useful for implementing validation or confirmation dialogs before allowing navigation to proceed in data-bound controls.
The Reason property indicates why the change is being attempted, allowing handlers to make context-aware decisions about whether to allow or cancel the operation.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Data.CurrentChangingEventArgs.#ctor(Telerik.WinControls.CurrentChangeReason)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified reason for the change.
member.param: A value indicating why the current item is changing.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Data.CurrentChangingEventArgs.Reason
member.summary: Gets the reason why the current item in the collection is changing.
member.value: A value indicating the cause of the current item change attempt.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Data.INotifyCollectionChanged
member.summary: Notifies listeners of dynamic changes, such as when items get added and removed or the whole list is refreshed.
member.remarks: You can enumerate over any collection that implements the IEnumerable interface. However, to set up dynamic bindings so that insertions or deletions in the collection update the UI automatically, the collection must implement the INotifyCollectionChanged interface. This interface exposes the CollectionChanged event that must be raised whenever the underlying collection changes.

member.name: E:Telerik.WinControls.Data.INotifyCollectionChanged.CollectionChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the collection changes.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Data.INotifyCollectionChanging
member.summary: Notifies listeners of dynamic changes, such as when items get added and removed or the whole list is refreshed.
member.remarks: You can enumerate over any collection that implements the IEnumerable interface. However, to set up dynamic bindings so that insertions or deletions in the collection update the UI automatically, the collection must implement the INotifyCollectionChanged interface. This interface exposes the CollectionChanged event that must be raised whenever the underlying collection changes.

member.name: E:Telerik.WinControls.Data.INotifyCollectionChanging.CollectionChanging
member.summary: Occurs before the collection changes.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadElementCollection
member.summary: Represents a strongly-typed collection of RadElement objects that manages the hierarchical relationships and lifecycle of child elements within the Telerik Presentation Framework.

remarks.para: RadElementCollection extends to provide specialized collection behavior for managing RadElement hierarchies. It automatically handles parent-child relationships, element lifecycle events, and ensures proper integration with the element tree structure.

The collection provides thread-safe operations for adding, removing, and enumerating elements while maintaining the integrity of the element tree. It supports collection suspension for batch operations and implements proper change notifications for layout and rendering updates.

Each collection is owned by a specific RadElement and enforces proper parent-child relationships, element state management, and cascading operations such as theme application and property inheritance throughout the element hierarchy.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadItemCollection
member.summary: Represents a specialized collection that stores and manages objects with support for ownership relationships, change notifications, and hierarchical item management.

remarks.para: RadItemCollection extends to provide comprehensive collection management specifically designed for RadItem objects within the Telerik WinControls framework. The collection automatically handles parent-child relationships, item lifecycle events, and ensures proper integration with the element tree structure.

The collection supports batch operations through notification suspension, change event handling, and maintains the integrity of item hierarchies. It provides strongly-typed access to items and implements proper change notifications for UI updates and layout recalculation.

Each collection is typically owned by a RadElement that acts as the logical parent for all items in the collection. The collection enforces proper ownership relationships and handles cascading operations such as theme application and property inheritance.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadItemOwnerCollection
member.summary: A collection that stores RadItem objects and manages their ownership relationships with a parent RadElement.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadItemVirtualizationCollection
member.summary: A specialized collection for RadItem objects that supports virtualization for performance optimization in large datasets.
member.remarks: This collection integrates with IVirtualViewport to provide virtualization capabilities, allowing UI controls to efficiently handle large numbers of items by only creating visual elements for items currently in view. The collection automatically notifies the viewport about data changes to maintain virtualization state.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadItemVirtualizationCollection.OwnerViewport
member.summary: Gets or sets the virtual viewport that manages the virtualization behavior for this collection.
member.value: The IVirtualViewport instance that handles virtualization operations.
member.remarks: The viewport is responsible for determining which items are visible and need to be realized, and manages the virtualization lifecycle for performance optimization.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.ReadOnlyControlCollection
member.summary: A control collection that can be set to read-only mode to prevent modifications.
member.remarks: This collection extends the standard Control.ControlCollection with the ability to enforce read-only behavior. When in read-only mode, all modification operations throw exceptions, but internal methods can still be used for controlled modifications.

member.exception: Thrown when the collection is read-only.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.ObjectRelation
member.summary: Represents a relationship between data objects, providing hierarchical data structure support for data binding scenarios in Telerik WinControls.

remarks.para: The class enables the creation of master-detail relationships between different data sources, including DataTable, DataView, BindingSource, and other enumerable collections.
This class is particularly useful in scenarios where you need to establish parent-child relationships between data entities, such as displaying hierarchical data in grid controls or tree structures.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ObjectRelation.GetObjectRelation(System.Object)
member.summary: Creates an appropriate instance based on the type of the specified list.
member.param: The data source object to create a relation for. Can be a BindingSource, DataTable, DataView, or any other enumerable collection.
member.returns: An instance appropriate for the specified data source type. Returns a for DataTable or DataView objects, otherwise returns a standard .
member.remarks: This factory method automatically determines the most appropriate ObjectRelation type based on the input data source, handling BindingSource unwrapping and DataSet-specific relation creation.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ObjectRelation.GetObjectRelation(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Creates an instance for a specific data member within a data source.
member.param: The main data source object containing the data member.
The name of the specific data member or table within the data source to create a relation for.
member.returns: An instance for the specified data member, or null if the data member cannot be resolved.
member.remarks: This factory method is useful for creating relations to specific tables within DataSets or other complex data sources that contain multiple related data entities.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ObjectRelation.#ctor(System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified data list.
member.param: The data source list to create the relation for.
member.remarks: This constructor automatically initializes child relations collection and performs initial setup of the object relation hierarchy.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ObjectRelation.#ctor(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified data source and data member.
member.param: The main data source containing the data member.
The name of the data member within the data source.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.ObjectRelation.Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets an object that contains additional data associated with this relation.
member.value: An that contains data to associate with this relation. The default value is null.
member.remarks: The Tag property can be used to store any additional information that you want to associate with the object relation. This property is not used internally by the ObjectRelation class.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.ArrowPrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders directional arrows.

remarks.para: ArrowPrimitive provides rendering capabilities for arrows pointing in various directions (up, down, left, right). It's commonly used in dropdown buttons, scroll bars, menus, and other UI elements that require directional indicators.
The primitive extends BasePrimitive and supports various arrow styles, sizes, and colors. It automatically handles arrow direction and scales appropriately based on the available space.
The class defines minimum sizes for horizontal and vertical arrows to ensure proper visual representation even in constrained layouts.

summary.para: Initializes a new instance of the ArrowPrimitive class.
Initializes a new instance of the ArrowPrimitive class using the ArrowDirection enumeration. Possible directions are up, bottom, left, and right.

member.summary: Determines whether to paint the arrow using anti-aliasing. Default value is false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the arrow direction. The possible values are contained in the ArrowDirection enumeration: up, left, right, and bottom.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.BasePrimitive
member.summary: Represents the base class for all primitive elements in the Telerik WinControls framework.

remarks.para: Primitives are RadElement instances that are actually rendered on the screen, such as borders, fills, text, images, and other visual components. They form the building blocks of complex controls.
This base class defines the core painting infrastructure that all primitives must implement through the method.
All primitive classes should inherit from BasePrimitive and override the PaintPrimitive method to provide their specific rendering logic.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.BasePrimitive.PaintPrimitive(Telerik.WinControls.Paint.IGraphics,System.Single,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, performs the actual painting of the primitive.
member.param: The object used for painting operations.
The rotation angle in degrees to apply during painting.
The scaling factor to apply during painting.
member.remarks: This is the core method that derived primitive classes must override to implement their specific rendering logic. The base implementation is empty and should be overridden.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.BasePrimitive.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the primitive has visual content to render.
member.value: true if the primitive has no content and should not be painted; otherwise, false. The default implementation returns false, indicating the primitive has content.
member.remarks: This property is used for optimization purposes to avoid unnecessary painting operations when a primitive has no visual content to display.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.BorderPrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders borders around other elements with comprehensive styling and customization options.

remarks.para: BorderPrimitive is a fundamental rendering component in the Telerik WinControls framework that provides sophisticated border rendering capabilities. It supports multiple border styles including solid, dotted, dashed, double borders, and complex multi-side border configurations with individual styling per side.

Key features include:
Multiple border box styles: single border, four-sided borders, and outer-inner border combinations
Individual side styling with different colors, widths, and styles for top, bottom, left, and right borders
Support for various border drawing modes and gradient effects
Integration with shape primitives for rounded corners and custom border shapes
Automatic thickness calculation and parent element border synchronization

BorderPrimitive is commonly used in conjunction with to create complete visual styling for RadElements, providing both background fills and border outlines. It automatically handles DPI scaling and provides optimized rendering performance through caching and buffer management.
The primitive integrates seamlessly with the theming system and supports inheritance of border properties from parent elements, making it suitable for complex nested control scenarios.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.BorderPrimitive.PaintPrimitive(Telerik.WinControls.Paint.IGraphics,System.Single,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Renders the border primitive using the specified graphics context with rotation and scaling support.
member.param: The graphics context to use for rendering the border.
The rotation angle in degrees to apply during rendering.
The scaling factor to apply during rendering.
member.remarks: This method delegates the actual border painting to the internal border implementation, which handles the complex rendering logic for different border styles, shapes, and effects. The rendering is optimized for performance and supports advanced features like anti-aliasing and gradient effects.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.BorderPrimitive.GetBorderThickness
member.summary: Gets the border thickness.
member.returns: An instance of representing the border thickness.

para.span: Gets or sets the Border style. The two possible values are SingleBorder and FourBorder. In the single border case, all four sides share the same appearance although the entire border may have gradient. In four border case, each of the four sides may differ in appearance. For example, the left border may have different color, shadowcolor, and width from the rest. When SingleBorder is chosen, you should use the general properties such as width and color, and respectively, when the FourBorder style is chosen you should use properties prefixed with the corresponding side, for example, LeftColor, LeftWidth for the left side.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.CheckPrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders checkboxes with support for checked, unchecked, and indeterminate states.

remarks.para: CheckPrimitive extends RadioPrimitive to provide checkbox-specific functionality, including support for three-state checkboxes (checked, unchecked, indeterminate) and various visual styles.

The primitive supports different rendering styles such as XP style, custom styles, and can be configured to draw fills and other visual enhancements. It's commonly used in checkbox controls, data grid cells, and other UI elements that require checkbox functionality.
Unlike radio buttons, checkboxes rendered by this primitive can be independently selected and support tri-state behavior when needed.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.FillPrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders background fills and gradients.

remarks.para: FillPrimitive is used to paint solid colors, gradients, and other fill patterns as the background of RadElements. It supports various gradient styles including linear, radial, elliptical, and more.
The fill can be configured with multiple colors (up to 4) and various gradient properties such as angle, percentage positions, and gradient style to create complex visual effects.
This primitive is commonly used as a background element in most Telerik controls to provide visual styling and theming capabilities.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.FocusPrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders focus indicators for UI controls.

remarks.para: FocusPrimitive is responsible for drawing focus rectangles and other visual indicators that show when a control has keyboard focus. It typically renders a dotted or dashed border around the focused element to provide clear visual feedback to users.

The primitive supports various focus styles including standard Windows focus rectangles, custom border styles, and gradient-based focus indicators. It works in conjunction with BorderPrimitive to provide comprehensive focus visualization.
FocusPrimitive is essential for accessibility compliance and keyboard navigation support, ensuring that users can clearly identify which control currently has input focus.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GripPrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders a visual grip or handle, commonly used for resizing, moving, or indicating interactive areas within Telerik WinControls components.

remarks.para: The class provides specialized rendering capabilities for displaying grip handles consisting of a series of dots or small rectangular elements. These grips are typically used in splitters, resizable panels, toolbars, and other interactive elements where users need visual indication of draggable or resizable areas.

The primitive renders a vertical series of rectangular dots with shadow effects to create a three-dimensional appearance. The number of dots, colors, and spacing can be customized through various properties. Each dot consists of a main colored rectangle with a slightly offset shadow rectangle to enhance the visual depth.

Key features include customizable dot count through , configurable colors for main dots and shadows, automatic spacing calculation, and integration with the RadProperty system for consistent theming across the framework.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GripPrimitive.InitializeFields
member.summary: Initializes the default field values for the grip primitive.
member.remarks: This method configures the primitive to have fixed sizing by default, as grip handles typically have predetermined dimensions and should not stretch to fill available space. The primitive maintains its intrinsic size for consistent visual appearance.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GripPrimitive.StretchHorizontally
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the primitive should stretch horizontally to fill available space.
member.value: false by default. Grip primitives typically maintain fixed width for consistent appearance.
member.remarks: Grip handles are generally designed to have a fixed width to ensure consistent visual appearance and proper user interaction. Setting this to true may cause the grip to appear distorted.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GripPrimitive.StretchVertically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the primitive should stretch vertically to fill available space.
member.value: false by default. Grip primitives typically maintain fixed height for consistent appearance.
member.remarks: While grip handles may vary in height based on their container, they typically maintain consistent spacing and dot size. Setting this to true should be done carefully to maintain proper visual proportions.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GripPrimitive.NumberOfDotsProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.remarks: This property controls how many individual dot elements are rendered in the grip handle, affecting the overall visual density and length of the grip indicator.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GripPrimitive.BackColor2Property
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.remarks: This property defines the shadow color used to create a three-dimensional effect for the grip dots, enhancing the visual depth and making the grip more prominent.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GripPrimitive.BackColor2
member.summary: Gets or sets the shadow color used for creating depth effect in the grip dots.
member.value: A value representing the shadow color. The default value is .

remarks.para: This color is used to render shadow rectangles slightly offset from the main grip dots, creating a three-dimensional appearance that makes the grip more visually prominent. The shadow is typically rendered in a lighter color than the main dots.
For best visual results, this color should contrast appropriately with both the main and the containing element's background.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GripPrimitive.NumberOfDots
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of dots to display in the grip handle.
member.value: An integer value representing the number of dot elements to render. The default value is 4.

remarks.para: This property determines how many individual dot elements are rendered vertically within the grip handle. More dots create a longer grip that may be easier to grab, while fewer dots create a more compact appearance.
The dots are evenly spaced based on the primitive's height and the number of dots specified. Each dot is rendered as a small rectangle with an associated shadow for depth effect.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GripPrimitive.PaintPrimitive(Telerik.WinControls.Paint.IGraphics,System.Single,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Renders the grip handle using the specified graphics context, applying rotation and scaling transformations.
member.param: The interface used for drawing the grip dots.
The rotation angle in degrees to apply to the rendered content.
The scaling factor to apply to the rendered content.

remarks.para: This method renders a series of small rectangular dots arranged vertically to create a grip handle appearance. Each dot consists of two rectangles: a shadow rectangle (rendered with ) and a main rectangle (rendered with ).
The rendering process:

item.description: Calculates the spacing between dots based on the primitive's height and
Renders each dot as a 2x2 pixel rectangle starting from the top
For each dot, first renders a shadow rectangle offset by 0.1 pixels
Then renders the main dot rectangle on top
Continues until reaching the bottom of the primitive or running out of space

remarks.para: The dots are positioned with a 4-pixel vertical offset from the top and spaced 4 pixels apart vertically. Each dot is 2x2 pixels in size with a subtle shadow effect for depth.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders visual indicators for expandable/collapsible group states, commonly used in panel bars, tree views, and other hierarchical controls within the Telerik WinControls framework.

remarks.para: The class provides specialized rendering capabilities for displaying expand/collapse indicators with support for multiple visual styles including Visual Studio 2005 ToolBox and Explorer Bar styles. The primitive automatically adapts its visual representation based on the current state (expanded or collapsed) and the selected panel bar style.

This primitive is typically used as part of larger composite elements in panel bars, accordion controls, and tree view implementations where users need visual feedback about the current state of expandable sections. The primitive supports anti-aliased rendering for smooth visual appearance and provides configurable styling options through the property.

Key features include state-based rendering (expanded/collapsed), multiple visual styles (ToolBox/Explorer), anti-aliased graphics for smooth appearance, and integration with the RadProperty system for consistent theming and styling across the framework.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive.GroupState
member.summary: Defines the possible states for a group element in expandable/collapsible controls.
member.remarks: This enumeration is used to control the visual representation of the group state indicator, determining whether the associated group or panel is currently expanded or collapsed.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive.GroupState.Expanded
member.summary: Indicates that the group is expanded and its content is visible. In this state, the primitive typically renders a collapse indicator (minus sign or down arrow).

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive.GroupState.Collapsed
member.summary: Indicates that the group is collapsed and its content is hidden. In this state, the primitive typically renders an expand indicator (plus sign or right arrow).

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive.InitializeFields
member.summary: Initializes the default field values for the group state primitive.
member.remarks: This method sets up the primitive to have fixed sizing by default, as group state indicators typically have a predetermined size and should not stretch to fill available space. The primitive is configured to maintain its intrinsic dimensions for consistent appearance.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive.StretchHorizontally
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the primitive should stretch horizontally to fill available space.
member.value: false by default. Group state indicators typically maintain fixed width for consistent appearance.
member.remarks: Group state primitives are generally designed to have a fixed size to ensure consistent visual appearance across different container sizes. Setting this to true may cause the indicator to appear distorted.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive.StretchVertically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the primitive should stretch vertically to fill available space.
member.value: false by default. Group state indicators typically maintain fixed height for consistent appearance.
member.remarks: Group state primitives are generally designed to have a fixed size to ensure consistent visual appearance across different container sizes. Setting this to true may cause the indicator to appear distorted.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive.GroupStyleProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.remarks: This property determines the visual style used for rendering the group state indicator, affecting how the expand/collapse visual cues are displayed to the user.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive.PanelBarStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the visual style for the panel bar group state indicator.
member.value: A enumeration value that determines the visual appearance of the group state indicator. The default value is .

remarks.para: This property controls how the expand/collapse indicator is visually represented:

item.description: : Renders simple line-based indicators similar to Visual Studio's toolbox
: Renders filled arrow-shaped indicators with double arrows for enhanced visibility

remarks.para: Changing this property triggers a repaint of the primitive to reflect the new visual style. The style affects both the expanded and collapsed state representations.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive.GroupStateProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.remarks: This property controls whether the group is currently expanded or collapsed, which directly affects the visual representation of the state indicator.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive.State
member.summary: Gets or sets the current state of the group (expanded or collapsed).
member.value: A enumeration value indicating whether the group is expanded or collapsed. The default value is .

remarks.para: This property determines the visual representation of the group state indicator:

item.description: : Shows collapse indicators (minus signs, down arrows, etc.)
: Shows expand indicators (plus signs, right arrows, etc.)

remarks.para: The exact visual representation depends on the current setting. Changing this property triggers an immediate repaint to show the updated state.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive.PaintPrimitive(Telerik.WinControls.Paint.IGraphics,System.Single,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Renders the group state indicator using the specified graphics context, applying rotation and scaling transformations.
member.param: The interface used for drawing the state indicator.
The rotation angle in degrees to apply to the rendered content.
The scaling factor to apply to the rendered content.

remarks.para: This method renders different visual indicators based on the current and values:

item.description: Expanded: Renders a horizontal line across the center
Collapsed: Renders both horizontal and vertical lines forming a plus sign
Expanded: Renders double up-pointing arrow polygons with shadow effect
Collapsed: Renders double down-pointing arrow polygons with shadow effect

remarks.para: The method uses anti-aliased rendering for smooth visual appearance and applies the primitive's for the main indicator elements.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.GroupStatePrimitive.MeasureOverride(System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Measures the desired size of the group state primitive within the specified available size.
member.param: The available size that this primitive can be given.
member.returns: The representing the desired size of the primitive. Returns a minimum size of 10x10 pixels to ensure the indicator remains visible and interactive.

remarks.para: This method ensures that all child elements have their Measure method called during the layout process, then returns a consistent minimum size for the group state indicator. The fixed minimum size ensures that the indicator remains visible and clickable regardless of the available space.

The 10x10 pixel minimum size provides sufficient area for rendering both simple line-based indicators (Visual Studio ToolBox style) and more complex polygon-based indicators (Explorer Bar style) while maintaining good usability for mouse and touch interactions.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.ImagePrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders images with comprehensive scaling, layout, transformation, and caching capabilities.

remarks.para: ImagePrimitive is a versatile rendering component in the Telerik WinControls framework that provides sophisticated image display functionality supporting both raster images (bitmap, PNG, JPEG, etc.) and vector images (SVG). It offers advanced features for image presentation including multiple scaling modes, layout options, rotation and flip transformations, transparency handling, and performance optimization.

Key capabilities include:
Support for both and content
Multiple layout modes: Center, Stretch, Tile, Zoom, and None for flexible image positioning
Advanced scaling options with DPI awareness and custom size specifications
Image transformation support including rotation and flipping operations
Integration with ImageList components for icon management and organization
Transparency color handling and alpha channel support
Performance optimization through intelligent caching and animated image support

The primitive is extensively used throughout Telerik controls in buttons, menu items, toolbars, tree nodes, and other UI elements requiring image display. It automatically handles image disposal and memory management to prevent resource leaks, while providing smooth animation support for animated image formats.

ImagePrimitive integrates seamlessly with the theming system, supporting property inheritance and style-based image assignment, making it ideal for creating consistent visual experiences across complex control hierarchies.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.LinePrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders lines and separators with configurable orientation and styling.

remarks.para: LinePrimitive extends FillPrimitive to provide line drawing capabilities including horizontal and vertical separators, diagonal lines, and custom angle lines. It supports various line widths, colors, and gradient effects.

The primitive is commonly used for drawing separators in menus, toolbars, and panels, as well as decorative lines in UI layouts. It automatically handles DPI scaling to ensure consistent appearance across different display resolutions.
LinePrimitive can render both simple solid lines and complex gradient-filled lines using the inherited fill capabilities from its base class.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OutLookGripPrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders an Outlook-style grip handle, specifically designed for resizing and moving interface elements in Microsoft Outlook-like applications within the Telerik WinControls framework.

remarks.para: The class extends to provide specialized rendering capabilities for Outlook-style grip handles. These grips are characterized by a horizontal row of dots arranged in the center of the element, providing a distinctive visual indicator for interactive areas that can be dragged or resized.

Unlike the vertical , this primitive renders 9 dots horizontally centered within the element, creating the familiar Outlook grip appearance commonly seen in pane separators, toolbars, and resizable interface elements. Each dot includes a white shadow effect for enhanced visual depth and better visibility against various background colors.

The primitive inherits fill capabilities from its base class, allowing for background rendering before drawing the grip dots. It also sets a high Z-index (10000) to ensure the grip appears above other visual elements in the same container.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OutLookGripPrimitive.CreateChildElements
member.summary: Creates and initializes child elements for the Outlook grip primitive.

remarks.para: This method performs the base initialization and sets a high Z-index value to ensure the grip primitive appears above other visual elements in the same container. The high Z-index (10000) guarantees that the grip remains visible and interactive even when other elements are layered in the same visual tree.
The Z-index setting is particularly important for grip elements as they need to remain accessible for user interaction regardless of other visual elements that might be present in the same container.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OutLookGripPrimitive.PaintPrimitive(Telerik.WinControls.Paint.IGraphics,System.Single,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Renders the Outlook-style grip handle using the specified graphics context, applying rotation and scaling transformations.
member.param: The interface used for drawing the grip dots.
The rotation angle in degrees to apply to the rendered content.
The scaling factor to apply to the rendered content.

remarks.para: This method first calls the base method to render any background fill, then overlays the characteristic Outlook-style grip pattern consisting of 9 horizontal dots arranged in a single row.
The rendering process:

item.description: Renders the base fill background if configured
Calculates the starting position centered horizontally (width/2 - 18 pixels)
Renders 9 dots horizontally with 4-pixel spacing between each dot
Each dot consists of a white shadow rectangle and a black main rectangle
Shadow rectangles are offset by 0.1 pixels for subtle depth effect

remarks.para: The dots start at a vertical position of 4 pixels from the top and are each 2x2 pixels in size. The horizontal spacing creates the distinctive Outlook grip appearance that users recognize as an interactive handle for resizing or moving interface elements.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders directional overflow indicators, typically used to show that content extends beyond the visible area and can be scrolled or expanded in a specific direction.

remarks.para: The class provides specialized rendering capabilities for displaying directional arrow indicators that inform users about hidden or overflow content. These indicators are commonly used in toolbars, menus, tab strips, and other container controls where not all content may be visible due to space constraints.

The primitive supports four directional orientations (Up, Down, Left, Right) and renders styled arrow indicators with shadow effects for enhanced visual depth. Each direction has its own specialized rendering implementation that creates appropriate visual cues for the direction of overflow content.

Key features include directional arrow rendering with anti-aliasing, configurable shadow colors for depth effects, optional arrow drawing control, automatic sizing based on direction, and integration with the RadProperty system for consistent theming across the framework.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.ArrowDirectionProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.remarks: This property determines the direction of the overflow arrow indicator, affecting both the visual appearance and the automatic sizing behavior of the primitive.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.ShadowColorProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.remarks: This property controls the color used for shadow effects in the overflow arrow, enhancing the visual depth and making the indicator more prominent against various backgrounds.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.DrawArrowProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.remarks: This property provides control over whether the arrow indicator is actually rendered, allowing the primitive to be temporarily hidden while maintaining its layout space.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.MinHorizontalSize
member.summary: Defines the minimum size for horizontal overflow arrows (Left and Right directions).
member.remarks: This size ensures adequate space for rendering horizontal arrow indicators while maintaining good usability for mouse and touch interactions. The 4x8 pixel size provides sufficient visual presence without consuming excessive layout space.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.MinVerticalSize
member.summary: Defines the minimum size for vertical overflow arrows (Up and Down directions).
member.remarks: This size ensures adequate space for rendering vertical arrow indicators while maintaining good usability for mouse and touch interactions. The 8x10 pixel size provides sufficient visual presence without consuming excessive layout space.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.#ctor(Telerik.WinControls.ArrowDirection)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified arrow direction.
member.param: The direction of the overflow arrow indicator.

remarks.para: This constructor sets up the overflow primitive with the specified direction and automatically determines the appropriate minimum size based on the arrow orientation:

item.description: Left/Right arrows use (4x8 pixels)
Up/Down arrows use (8x10 pixels)

remarks.para: The constructor ensures that the primitive has an appropriate size for the specified direction, providing adequate space for rendering the arrow indicator while maintaining good usability.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.InitializeFields
member.summary: Initializes the default field values for the overflow primitive.
member.remarks: This method configures the primitive to have fixed sizing by default, as overflow indicators typically have predetermined dimensions and should not stretch to fill available space. The primitive maintains its intrinsic size for consistent visual appearance.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.StretchHorizontally
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the primitive should stretch horizontally to fill available space.
member.value: false by default. Overflow indicators typically maintain fixed width for consistent appearance.
member.remarks: Overflow arrows are generally designed to have a fixed size to ensure consistent visual appearance and proper user interaction. Setting this to true may cause the arrow to appear distorted.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.StretchVertically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the primitive should stretch vertically to fill available space.
member.value: false by default. Overflow indicators typically maintain fixed height for consistent appearance.
member.remarks: Overflow arrows are generally designed to have a fixed size to ensure consistent visual appearance and proper user interaction. Setting this to true may cause the arrow to appear distorted.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.Direction
member.summary: Gets or sets the direction of the overflow arrow indicator.
member.value: An enumeration value specifying the direction of the overflow indicator. The default value is .

remarks.para: This property determines both the visual appearance of the arrow and the automatic sizing behavior:

item.description: : Points left, uses horizontal sizing
: Points right, uses horizontal sizing
: Points up, uses vertical sizing
: Points down, uses vertical sizing

remarks.para: Changing this property automatically adjusts the primitive's size to match the appropriate minimum dimensions for the new direction and triggers a layout invalidation.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.ShadowColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the color used for shadow effects in the overflow arrow.
member.value: A value representing the shadow color. The default value is .

remarks.para: This color is used to render shadow elements that enhance the visual depth of the overflow arrow, making it more prominent and easier to see against various background colors. The shadow effect helps distinguish the arrow from the surrounding content.
For best visual results, this color should provide appropriate contrast with both the main arrow color () and the containing element's background.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.DrawArrow
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the overflow arrow should be rendered.
member.value: true to render the arrow indicator; false to hide it. The default value is true.

remarks.para: This property allows the overflow indicator to be temporarily hidden while maintaining its layout space and other properties. When set to false, the method returns immediately without rendering any visual content.
This is useful in scenarios where overflow indicators need to be conditionally shown based on content state, available space, or user preferences without requiring layout changes.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.PaintPrimitive(Telerik.WinControls.Paint.IGraphics,System.Single,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Renders the overflow arrow indicator using the specified graphics context, applying rotation and scaling transformations.
member.param: The interface used for drawing the overflow arrow.
The rotation angle in degrees to apply to the rendered content.
The scaling factor to apply to the rendered content.

remarks.para: This method renders directional arrow indicators with anti-aliased graphics for smooth appearance. Each direction has its own specialized rendering implementation:
Left Arrow: Renders a left-pointing triangle with background accent lines
Right Arrow: Renders a right-pointing triangle with foreground accent line
Up Arrow: Renders an up-pointing triangle with background accent lines
Down Arrow: Renders a down-pointing double-triangle with shadow effect using both and
The method respects the property and returns immediately without rendering if the arrow is disabled. Anti-aliasing is enabled for smooth triangle edges and restored after rendering.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.OverflowPrimitive.OnPropertyChanged(Telerik.WinControls.RadPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Handles property changes for the overflow primitive, specifically responding to direction changes.
member.param: A that contains the event data.

remarks.para: This method responds to changes in the property by automatically adjusting the primitive's size to match the appropriate minimum dimensions for the new direction:

item.description: Left/Right directions: Sets size to (4x8 pixels)
Up/Down directions: Sets size to (8x10 pixels)

remarks.para: The sizing behavior respects the property:

item.description: When AutoSize is enabled: Updates the property
When AutoSize is disabled: Updates the property directly

remarks.para: This automatic sizing ensures that the arrow indicator always has adequate space for proper rendering and user interaction regardless of the direction change.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.ProgressBarPrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders progress bars with support for various styles, orientations, and customization options.

remarks.para: ProgressBarPrimitive extends FillPrimitive to provide comprehensive progress bar rendering capabilities, including linear and circular progress indicators, stepped progress display, and dual-value range support. It supports both determinate and indeterminate progress visualization modes.

The primitive supports various visual styles including gradient fills, custom separators, dash patterns, and different orientations. It can render progress with customizable minimum/maximum ranges and step values, making it suitable for complex progress tracking scenarios.
ProgressBarPrimitive is commonly used in progress controls, loading indicators, status displays, and any UI element requiring visual progress feedback to users.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.ProgressBarPrimitive.HasImage
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the progress bar has an associated image.
member.value: true if the progress bar displays an image; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When set to true, this property indicates that the progress bar should consider image rendering in its layout and painting operations. This affects how the progress bar calculates its visual representation and may influence spacing and alignment.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.ProgressBarPrimitive.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets progress bar orientation. Possible values are indicates in ProgressOrientaion enumeration: up, left, bottom, and right.

summary.para: Indicates whether the progress bar style is dash. If both dash and hash are true, hatch style is chosen.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.ProgressBarPrimitive.Hatch
member.summary: Indicates whether the progress bar style is hatch. When true, the style is Hatch. When both dash and hatch are true the style is hatch.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.ProgressBarPrimitive.SweepAngle

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.ProgressBarPrimitive.Value2
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of the second progress line. There could be two progress lines in the progress bar.

member.summary: Specifies minimum value for the progress.

member.summary: Gets or sets maximum value for the progress.

member.summary: Gets or sets the step value used for discrete progress increments.
member.value: An integer value representing the increment amount for step-based progress updates.
member.remarks: The step value determines the amount by which the progress value increases when using step-based progress updates. This is useful for operations that complete in discrete, measurable increments rather than continuous progress.

member.summary: Gets or sets the first color that is used in gradient effect.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.ProgressBarPrimitive.SeparatorColor2

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.RadioPrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders radio button indicators with circular selection states.

remarks.para: RadioPrimitive extends FillPrimitive to provide radio button-specific rendering capabilities, including circular selection indicators and mutually exclusive selection behavior support. It renders the visual representation of radio button states (selected/unselected).

The primitive supports various visual styles and can render gradient fills, custom shapes, and different color schemes for the radio button indicator. It typically displays as a circular element with a filled center when selected.
RadioPrimitive is commonly used in radio button controls, option lists, and other UI elements that require mutually exclusive selection indicators.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.RadioPrimitive.InitializeFields
member.summary: Initializes the default field values for the radio primitive.

remarks.para: This method configures the radio primitive with appropriate default settings including:

item.description: Minimum size of 13x13 pixels for adequate visual representation
Fixed sizing (no stretching) to maintain circular radio button appearance
Default black colors for background and foreground elements

remarks.para: These defaults ensure that radio buttons maintain consistent visual appearance and proper sizing for user interaction across different layouts and scaling scenarios.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.RadioPrimitive.UseParentShape
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this primitive should use its parent's shape for rendering.
member.value: true if the primitive should inherit and use the parent element's shape; otherwise, false. The default value is true.
member.remarks: When enabled, this property allows the radio primitive to adopt the shape defined by its parent element, providing visual consistency in complex control hierarchies. When disabled, the primitive uses its default rectangular rendering approach.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.RadioPrimitive.PaintPrimitive(Telerik.WinControls.Paint.IGraphics,System.Single,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Renders the radio button primitive using the specified graphics context with rotation and scaling support.
member.param: The graphics context to use for rendering the radio button.
The rotation angle in degrees to apply during rendering.
The scaling factor to apply during rendering.

remarks.para: This method performs comprehensive radio button rendering including parameter validation, gradient color setup, and shape-based or rectangular rendering depending on configuration.
The rendering process supports up to 4 gradient colors and automatically handles different gradient styles, parent shape inheritance, and various radio button visual states.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders text content with advanced formatting, layout, and styling capabilities.

remarks.para: TextPrimitive is the primary text rendering component in the Telerik WinControls framework, providing comprehensive text display functionality including word wrapping, text alignment, mnemonics, ellipsis, orientation control, and multiple rendering hints.

The primitive supports various text formatting options such as HTML rendering, shadow effects, keyboard cues, and both horizontal and vertical text orientation. It automatically handles text measurement and layout based on available space and configured properties.
TextPrimitive is widely used throughout Telerik controls for displaying labels, captions, button text, menu items, and other textual content with consistent styling and behavior.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.TextRenderingHint
member.summary: Gets or sets the text rendering hint that controls the quality and appearance of text rendering.
member.value: A value that specifies the text rendering quality. The default value is .
member.remarks: This property determines the quality of text rendering, affecting anti-aliasing, hinting, and overall text appearance. Use for smooth text rendering or for optimal LCD display quality.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.DisabledTextRenderingHint
member.summary: Gets or sets the text rendering hint used when this primitive is disabled.
member.value: A value that specifies the text rendering quality for disabled state. The default value is .
member.remarks: This property allows for different text rendering quality when the primitive is disabled, often providing a softer appearance that visually indicates the disabled state.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.Impl
member.summary: This property is used internally.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.Text
member.summary: Gets or sets the text content displayed by this primitive.
member.value: A string containing the text to display. Returns an empty string if the value is null.

remarks.para: The text property supports various formatting features including mnemonics (ampersand characters), HTML rendering capabilities, and automatic layout adjustments based on the available space.
Setting this property automatically triggers layout invalidation and may enable HTML rendering if the text contains HTML markup and HTML rendering is not explicitly disabled.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.StretchHorizontally
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this primitive stretches horizontally within its parent layout.
member.value: true if the primitive should stretch horizontally; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: For text primitives, horizontal stretching is typically disabled to maintain text layout integrity and prevent unwanted text spacing or alignment issues.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.StretchVertically
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this primitive stretches vertically within its parent layout.
member.value: true if the primitive should stretch vertically; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: For text primitives, vertical stretching is typically disabled to maintain proper text positioning and prevent text from being improperly aligned within the available vertical space.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.AutoEllipsis
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the additional label text is to be indicated by an ellipsis.
member.value: true if the additional label text is to be indicated by an ellipsis otherwise, false. Default value is true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.MeasureTrailingSpaces
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether trailing spaces at the end of each line are included in text measurement calculations.
member.value: true to include trailing spaces in text measurement; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

remarks.para: By default, the boundary rectangle returned by text measurement methods excludes trailing spaces at the end of each line. Setting this property to true includes that space in measurement, which can be important for precise layout calculations and text alignment scenarios.
This property is particularly useful when working with text that needs to maintain exact spacing or when implementing custom text layout algorithms.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.TextWrap
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the text should wrapped to the available layout rectangle.
member.value: true if the text should wrapped to the available layout rectangle otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.UseMnemonic
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the control interprets an ampersand character (&) in the control's Text property to be an access key prefix character.
member.returns: true if the label doesn't display the ampersand character and underlines the character after the ampersand in its displayed text and treats the underlined character as an access key; otherwise, false if the ampersand character is displayed in the text of the control. The default is true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.ShowKeyboardCues
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether if the keyboard accelerators are visible.
member.value: true if if the keyboard accelerators are visible otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.TextOrientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the text orientation for rendering.
member.value: An value that specifies whether text is rendered horizontally or vertically. The default value is .
member.remarks: When set to , the text is rotated 90 degrees counterclockwise. This property is useful for creating vertical labels, headers, or other UI elements that require rotated text display.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.FlipText
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the text should be flipped (mirrored) during rendering.
member.value: true if the text should be flipped; otherwise, false. The default value is false.
member.remarks: Text flipping creates a mirror image of the text, which can be useful for special visual effects or when implementing right-to-left language support with custom rendering requirements. This property works in conjunction with for advanced text transformations.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.TextAlignment
member.summary: Gets or sets the text alignment within the primitive's bounds.
member.value: A value that specifies how text is aligned within the available space. The default value is .
member.remarks: This property controls both horizontal and vertical text alignment. Common values include , , and among others, providing flexible text positioning within the primitive's layout bounds.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.IsEmpty
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this primitive contains any displayable content.
member.value: true if the property is null or empty; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property is used by the layout system and rendering engine to optimize operations by skipping empty text primitives during layout calculations and paint operations.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TextPrimitive.LineLimit
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether text rendering is limited to a specific number of lines.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Primitives.TrackBarPrimitive
member.summary: Represents a primitive element that renders track bar controls with slider functionality and tick mark support.

remarks.para: TrackBarPrimitive extends FillPrimitive to provide comprehensive track bar rendering capabilities, including horizontal and vertical orientations, customizable tick marks, slider area styling, and thumb positioning. It supports both visual and functional aspects of track bar controls.

The primitive supports various tick styles (top, bottom, both, none), customizable slider areas, gradient backgrounds, and precise thumb positioning. It handles minimum/maximum range values and tick frequency settings for precise value selection interfaces.
TrackBarPrimitive is commonly used in slider controls, volume controls, range selectors, and any UI element requiring value selection through sliding interaction.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement
member.summary: Represents a visual element that integrates with the Visual Studio component model, providing design-time support and data binding capabilities for elements in the Telerik Presentation Framework.

remarks.para: RadComponentElement extends with full component model integration, implementing and to enable seamless integration with Visual Studio designers, property grids, and data binding systems.

This class provides the foundation for elements that need to participate in design-time operations such as property serialization, designer services, and component lifecycle management. It handles proper cleanup of designer resources and component registration during disposal.

RadComponentElement serves as the base class for and other interactive elements that require component model integration for advanced design-time scenarios and data binding support within the TPF architecture.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.DisposeManagedResources
member.summary: Releases the managed resources used by the RadComponentElement and optionally releases the unmanaged resources.
member.remarks: This method handles proper cleanup of design-time resources including removal of the component from the designer host when running in design mode. It ensures proper component lifecycle management in Visual Studio designer scenarios.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the RadComponentElement, including its site name if available.
member.returns: A string containing the site name and type name if the element has a site; otherwise, just the type name.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.OnPropertyChanged(Telerik.WinControls.RadPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the PropertyChanged event and handles binding context updates.
member.param: A that contains the event data.
member.remarks: This override ensures that data binding context changes are properly propagated to all associated data bindings when the changes.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.GetService(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets a service object of the specified type from the component's site.
member.param: The type of service to retrieve.
member.returns: An object that implements the requested service, or null if the service cannot be resolved.
member.remarks: This method provides access to design-time services when the component is sited in a designer. Common services include IDesignerHost, ITypeDescriptorContext, and other designer services.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.UpdateBindings(Telerik.WinControls.RadPropertyChangedEventArgs)
member.summary: Updates all data bindings associated with this component when the binding context changes.
member.param: A that contains the property change information.
member.remarks: This method ensures that data binding relationships are properly maintained when the changes, refreshing all existing bindings to use the new context.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.CanRaiseEvents
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the component can raise events.
member.value: true if the component can raise events; otherwise, false. The default implementation always returns true.
member.remarks: This property can be overridden in derived classes to control event raising behavior based on component state or other conditions.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.Container
member.summary: Gets the container that contains the component.
member.value: The that contains the component, or null if the component is not sited.
member.remarks: This property provides access to the design-time container that manages this component's lifetime and provides services for component interaction and resource management.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.DesignMode
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the component is currently in design mode.
member.value: true if the component is in design mode; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property is used to determine if the component is being used in a design-time environment such as Visual Studio. It affects behavior for design-time scenarios versus runtime execution.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.IsDesignMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether design mode is active.
member.value: true if design mode is active; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This property overrides the base implementation to integrate with the component site's design mode state. When a site is available, the site's design mode takes precedence over the base implementation's value.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.Site
member.summary: Gets or sets the site of the component.
member.value: The associated with the component, or null if the component is not sited.
member.remarks: Setting this property integrates the component with the design-time environment, enabling access to designer services and proper design mode state management. When set to null, the component is removed from design mode.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.site
member.summary: The site associated with this component, providing access to design-time services.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.bindingsCollection
member.summary: The collection of data bindings associated with this component.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadComponentElement.DataBindings
member.summary: Gets the collection of data-binding objects for this component.
member.value: A that contains the data-binding objects for this component.
member.remarks: This collection manages all data binding relationships for the component, allowing properties to be bound to data sources. The collection is created on-demand and provides automatic synchronization between the component's properties and bound data sources.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadThemeManager
member.summary: Theme manager Component is used to load user-defined themes for RadControls in an application. Use the LoadedThemes property to add new team source files. Themes load immediately when correct property values specified and last for the life time of the application. After a theme is loaded it can be used by the corresponding types of controls placed on any Form of the application.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.CheckPrimitiveStyleEnum
member.summary: Specifies the visual style options available for CheckPrimitive elements.
member.remarks: This enumeration defines different visual styles that can be applied to CheckPrimitive elements, allowing controls to match various operating system visual themes and design standards. Each style affects the appearance of checkboxes, radio buttons, and other check-based UI elements.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.CheckPrimitiveStyleEnum.XP
member.summary: Specifies a Windows XP style appearance for check primitives.
member.remarks: This style provides the classic Windows XP look for checkboxes and radio buttons, featuring the characteristic rounded corners and gradient effects typical of the XP visual theme.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.CheckPrimitiveStyleEnum.Vista
member.summary: Specifies a Windows Vista/7 style appearance for check primitives.
member.remarks: This style provides the modern Windows Vista and Windows 7 look for checkboxes and radio buttons, featuring subtle gradients, refined borders, and the visual styling characteristic of the Aero theme.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.CheckPrimitiveStyleEnum.Mac
member.summary: Specifies a macOS style appearance for check primitives.
member.remarks: This style provides a Mac-like appearance for checkboxes and radio buttons, featuring the clean, minimalist design characteristics typical of macOS user interface elements.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.CheckPrimitiveStyleEnum.None
member.summary: Specifies that no specific style is applied to check primitives.
member.remarks: When set to None, the check primitive will not apply any predefined visual style, allowing for custom styling or minimal appearance. This option provides maximum flexibility for custom theming and styling scenarios.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.CheckPrimitiveStyleEnum.Win8
member.summary: Specifies a Windows 8 style appearance for check primitives.
member.remarks: This style provides the modern, flat design aesthetic characteristic of Windows 8 and later, featuring clean lines, minimal visual effects, and the Metro design language styling for checkboxes and radio buttons.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.ImageScaling
member.summary: Specifies how an image should be scaled to fit within its allocated space.
member.remarks: This enumeration defines the various scaling behaviors that can be applied to images when they need to be displayed in a space that may be different from their natural size. The scaling mode affects both the visual appearance and the aspect ratio preservation of the rendered image.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.ImageScaling.None
member.summary: The image is displayed at its original size without any scaling.
member.remarks: When None is specified, the image maintains its natural dimensions regardless of the available space. If the image is larger than the available space, it may be clipped. If the space is larger than the image, the image will not fill the entire area.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.ImageScaling.SizeToFit
member.summary: The image is scaled to fit within the available space while maintaining its aspect ratio.
member.remarks: When SizeToFit is specified, the image is scaled proportionally to fit entirely within the available bounds without distortion. The entire image will be visible, but there may be empty space if the aspect ratios don't match perfectly.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.SortStyle
member.summary: Defines the sorting style of items in a control.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.SortStyle.Ascending
member.summary: Indicates ascending sorting.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.SortStyle.Descending
member.summary: Indicates descending sorting.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.SortStyle.None
member.summary: Indicates no sorting.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.ToggleState
member.summary: Specifies the possible states for toggle controls such as checkboxes, checkmarks, and toggle buttons.
member.remarks: This enumeration provides a three-state toggle system that supports standard binary states (On/Off) as well as an indeterminate state commonly used in scenarios where the toggle represents a collection of items with mixed states.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.ToggleState.Off
member.summary: Indicates that the toggle control is in the "off" or unchecked state.
member.remarks: This represents the default, inactive, or false state of the toggle control. For checkboxes, this means unchecked; for radio buttons, this means not selected.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.ToggleState.On
member.summary: Indicates that the toggle control is in the "on" or checked state.
member.remarks: This represents the active, selected, or true state of the toggle control. For checkboxes, this means checked; for radio buttons, this means selected.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.ToggleState.Indeterminate
member.summary: Indicates that the toggle control is in an indeterminate or mixed state.
member.remarks: The indeterminate state is typically used when the toggle represents multiple items with different states, or when the current state cannot be determined. This is common in tree views with checkboxes where a parent node represents children with mixed states.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.TickStyles
member.summary: Specifies the position of tick marks on a track bar control.
member.remarks: This enumeration defines where tick marks appear relative to the track bar's slider track. For horizontal track bars, TopLeft means above the track and BottomRight means below. For vertical track bars, TopLeft means to the left of the track and BottomRight means to the right.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.TickStyles.None
member.summary: Specifies that no tick marks are displayed.
member.remarks: When set to None, the track bar displays only the slider track and thumb without any tick mark indicators.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.TickStyles.TopLeft
member.summary: Specifies that tick marks are displayed on the top side of horizontal track bars or the left side of vertical track bars.
member.remarks: For horizontal track bars, tick marks appear above the track. For vertical track bars, tick marks appear to the left of the track.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.TickStyles.BottomRight
member.summary: Specifies that tick marks are displayed on the bottom side of horizontal track bars or the right side of vertical track bars.
member.remarks: For horizontal track bars, tick marks appear below the track. For vertical track bars, tick marks appear to the right of the track.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Enumerations.TickStyles.Both
member.summary: Specifies that tick marks are displayed on both sides of the track bar.
member.remarks: When set to Both, tick marks appear on both the top and bottom of horizontal track bars, or on both the left and right sides of vertical track bars.
