member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.DisplayStyle
member.summary: Specifies which visual elements (image, text, or both) should be displayed in a control or element.
member.remarks: This enumeration is commonly used by RadControls to determine what content should be visible in buttons, menu items, toolbar items, and other elements that can display both images and text. The display style affects layout calculations and rendering behavior.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.DisplayStyle.None
member.summary: Specifies that neither image nor text content is rendered.
member.remarks: When set to None, the element will not display any image or text content, though it may still occupy space and display background, borders, or other visual elements.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.DisplayStyle.Text
member.summary: Specifies that only text content is rendered.
member.remarks: When set to Text, only the text content will be displayed. Any associated images will be hidden, and the layout will be optimized for text-only display.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.DisplayStyle.Image
member.summary: Specifies that only image content is rendered.
member.remarks: When set to Image, only the image content will be displayed. Any associated text will be hidden, and the layout will be optimized for image-only display.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.DisplayStyle.ImageAndText
member.summary: Specifies that both image and text content are rendered.
member.remarks: When set to ImageAndText, both the image and text content will be displayed according to the layout configuration. The relative positioning of image and text is typically controlled by additional properties such as TextImageRelation.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.Dock
member.summary: Specifies the position where an element should be docked within its parent container.
member.remarks: This enumeration is used by layout panels and controls to determine how child elements should be positioned and sized relative to the edges of their container. Docked elements typically stretch to fill the entire width or height of their designated edge.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.Dock.Left
member.summary: The element is docked to the left edge of its container.
member.remarks: When docked to the left, the element occupies the full height of the container and extends from the left edge to its natural or specified width.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.Dock.Top
member.summary: The element is docked to the top edge of its container.
member.remarks: When docked to the top, the element occupies the full width of the container and extends from the top edge to its natural or specified height.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.Dock.Right
member.summary: The element is docked to the right edge of its container.
member.remarks: When docked to the right, the element occupies the full height of the container and extends from the right edge to its natural or specified width.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.Dock.Bottom
member.summary: The element is docked to the bottom edge of its container.
member.remarks: When docked to the bottom, the element occupies the full width of the container and extends from the bottom edge to its natural or specified height.

summary.para: Content within a user interface is often larger than the visible area that the user can see. Large Telerik elements can be put in scroll viewer in order to scroll their content in small visible area.
Every element that support scrolling must implement this interface. Currently only class RadScrollViewer implements this interface and all Telerik elements that can be scrolled inherit that class.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.LayoutUtils
member.summary: Provides utility methods for layout calculations and operations in the Telerik RadControl framework. This class supports the TPF infrastructure and contains various helper methods for size calculations, alignment operations, and layout transformations.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.BoxLayout
member.summary: Represents a layout panel that arranges child elements in a horizontal or vertical box layout with proportional sizing support.

remarks.para: BoxLayout extends LayoutPanel to provide flexible box-based layout capabilities where child elements can be arranged in either horizontal or vertical orientation. Each child element can be assigned a proportion value that determines how much of the available space it should occupy relative to other children.

The layout supports proportional sizing through the attached property, allowing for dynamic space distribution among child elements. Elements with higher proportion values receive more space than those with lower values.
BoxLayout is commonly used in complex UI layouts where precise control over space distribution is required, such as in toolbars, panels, and container controls that need to adapt to different sizes.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.BoxLayout.StripPosition
member.summary: Represents the position where elements are arranged within the box layout.
member.remarks: This enumeration defines where new elements should be positioned within the layout container, affecting the visual order of elements in the rendered UI.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.BoxLayout.StripPosition.First
member.summary: Elements are positioned at the beginning of the layout container.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.BoxLayout.StripPosition.Last
member.summary: Elements are positioned at the end of the layout container.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.BoxLayout.ProportionProperty
member.summary: Identifies the attached dependency property.
member.remarks: This property is attached to child elements to specify their proportional size relative to other children in the layout. A value of 0.0 means the element uses its desired size, while positive values indicate proportional sharing of available space.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.BoxLayout.OrientationProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.remarks: This property determines whether child elements are arranged horizontally (in a row) or vertically (in a column) within the layout container.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.BoxLayout.StripPositionProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.remarks: This property determines the position where new elements are added to the layout container, affecting the visual ordering of child elements.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.BoxLayout.GetProportion(Telerik.WinControls.RadElement)
member.summary: Gets the proportion value of the specified element.
member.param: The element whose proportion value will be retrieved.
member.returns: A float value representing the element's proportion relative to other elements in the layout.
member.exception: Thrown when is null.
member.remarks: The proportion value determines how much of the available space an element should occupy relative to other elements. A value of 0.0 means the element uses its desired size, while positive values indicate proportional sharing of remaining space.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.BoxLayout.SetProportion(Telerik.WinControls.RadElement,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the proportion value for the specified element (attached property).
member.param: The element whose proportion value will be set.
The proportion value to assign to the element. Should be a positive value or 0.0.

remarks.para: This method sets the attached property that controls how much space the element should occupy relative to other elements in the BoxLayout. The proportion value works as follows:

item.description: 0.0: The element uses its desired/natural size
Positive values: The element shares available space proportionally with other elements

remarks.para: For example, if three elements have proportions of 1.0, 2.0, and 1.0 respectively, the middle element will receive twice as much space as the other two.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.BoxLayout.Orientation
member.summary: Gets or sets the orientation of the box layout, determining whether child elements are arranged horizontally or vertically.
member.value: An value indicating the arrangement direction. The default value is .

remarks.para: When set to , child elements are arranged side by side from left to right. When set to , child elements are arranged top to bottom.
Changing this property triggers a layout invalidation, causing all child elements to be repositioned according to the new orientation.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.DockLayoutPanel
member.summary: A layout panel that arranges child elements by docking them to specific edges of the available space with intelligent space management.
member.remarks: Provides comprehensive docking functionality similar to WinForms DockStyle. Child elements can be positioned at Left, Right, Top, or Bottom edges with sequential docking behavior and optional LastChildFill mode where the final child fills remaining central space.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.DockLayoutPanel.ArrangeOverride(System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Positions and sizes all child elements within the final layout area according to their dock positions.
member.param: The final area within the parent that the panel should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size used by the panel, which is the same as .

remarks.para:
This method performs the final layout arrangement by:
Processing child elements in collection order, giving earlier elements priority
Positioning each element according to its dock setting (Left, Right, Top, Bottom)
Reducing available space as each element is positioned
Handling the last child element according to the setting
Docked elements are positioned at their respective edges and consume space in the corresponding direction, while the final element (when is enabled) occupies the remaining central area.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.DockLayoutPanel.GetDock(Telerik.WinControls.RadElement)
member.summary: Gets the dock position attached property value for the specified element.
member.param: The element to retrieve the dock position from.
member.returns: A value indicating the element's docking position (Left, Right, Top, or Bottom).
member.exception: Thrown when is null.
member.remarks: This method retrieves the attached property that determines how the element will be positioned within the DockLayoutPanel. The dock position affects both the element's placement and how it influences the available space for other elements in the layout.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.DockLayoutPanel.MeasureOverride(System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Measures the size required to accommodate all child elements with their docking constraints.
member.param: The maximum available size that the panel can use.
member.returns: A representing the minimum size needed to display all child elements with their requested dock positions.

remarks.para:
This method implements the measurement logic for dock-based layout:
Measures each child element with the remaining available space
Accounts for space consumption based on dock positions (Left/Right consume width, Top/Bottom consume height)
Calculates total space requirements for optimal layout
Ensures that docked elements don't exceed available constraints
The measurement order follows the child collection sequence, where earlier elements take priority in space allocation, affecting the available space for subsequent elements.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.DockLayoutPanel.SetDock(Telerik.WinControls.RadElement,Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.Dock)
member.summary: Sets the dock position attached property value for the specified element.
member.param: The element to set the dock position for.
The docking position to assign to the element.
member.exception: Thrown when is null.

remarks.para: This method sets the attached property that determines how the element will be positioned within the DockLayoutPanel. Setting this property will trigger a layout invalidation if the element is currently part of a DockLayoutPanel's visual tree.

Valid dock positions are:
: Element docks to the left edge
: Element docks to the right edge
: Element docks to the top edge
: Element docks to the bottom edge

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.DockLayoutPanel.LastChildFill
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the last child element should fill the remaining available space.
member.value: true if the last child element should fill the remaining space after all other elements have been docked; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

remarks.para: When LastChildFill is enabled, the last child element in the collection will automatically fill the center area that remains after all other children have been positioned according to their dock settings. This is ideal for creating layouts where a main content area occupies the remaining space.
When LastChildFill is disabled, the last child element will be docked according to its dock setting just like any other child, potentially leaving empty space in the center of the layout.
Changes to this property trigger a layout invalidation and re-arrangement of all child elements.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.ElementWithCaptionLayoutPanel
member.summary: A specialized layout panel that arranges two child elements in a caption-body relationship with configurable positioning.

remarks.para: ElementWithCaptionLayoutPanel provides a structured layout for controls that require a caption or header element paired with a main body element. The panel automatically manages the spatial relationship between these two elements, supporting both top-caption and bottom-caption arrangements.

Key features include:
Automatic identification of caption and body elements through attached properties
Flexible caption positioning (top or bottom relative to the body)
Dynamic caption visibility control with layout adjustment
Intelligent space distribution between caption and body areas
Consistent sizing and alignment of both elements

This layout panel is commonly used in controls like group boxes, panels with titles, tabbed interfaces, and any UI elements where a descriptive caption needs to be consistently positioned relative to main content. Child elements are automatically categorized as either caption or body elements based on the CaptionElement attached property.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.ElementWithCaptionLayoutPanel.CaptionOnTop
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the caption element should be positioned above the body element.
member.value: true if the caption should be positioned at the top; false if it should be positioned at the bottom. The default value is false.

remarks.para: When CaptionOnTop is true, the caption element is arranged at the top of the layout area and the body element occupies the remaining space below. When false, the body element fills the upper area and the caption is positioned at the bottom.
Changing this property triggers a layout invalidation, causing all child elements to be repositioned according to the new arrangement.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.ElementWithCaptionLayoutPanel.ShowCaption
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the caption element should be visible and participate in layout.
member.value: true if the caption should be visible and allocated space in the layout; false if it should be hidden. The default value is true.

remarks.para: When ShowCaption is set to false, the caption element's visibility is set to , causing it to be completely removed from the layout calculations. The body element will then occupy the entire available space.
Setting this property to true restores the caption element's visibility to and re-includes it in layout calculations.
This property automatically initializes elements when changed to ensure proper caption and body identification.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.ElementWithCaptionLayoutPanel.ArrangeOverride(System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Positions and sizes the caption and body elements within the final layout area according to the current configuration.
member.param: The final area within the parent that the panel should use to arrange itself and its children.
member.returns: The actual size used by the panel, which is the same as .

remarks.para:
This method performs the final layout arrangement by:
Initializing and identifying caption and body elements
Calculating space requirements for both elements
Positioning elements based on the setting
Ensuring minimum caption height of 8 pixels when visible
Distributing remaining space to the body element
The caption element receives its desired height (minimum 8 pixels), while the body element gets the remaining vertical space. Both elements span the full width of the layout area.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.ElementWithCaptionLayoutPanel.MeasureOverride(System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Measures the size required to accommodate both caption and body elements within the specified constraints.
member.param: The maximum available size that the panel can use.
member.returns: A representing the minimum size needed to display both caption and body elements, constrained by the available size.

remarks.para:
This method calculates the total space requirements by:
Initializing and identifying caption and body elements
Measuring both elements using the base measurement logic
Calculating combined width (maximum of both elements) and height (sum of both elements)
Constraining the result within the available size limits
The resulting size ensures that both elements can be displayed with their desired dimensions, with the width being the maximum needed by either element and the height being the sum of both.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.GridLayout
member.summary: A layout panel that arranges child elements in a sophisticated grid structure with configurable rows, columns, spanning, and advanced sizing modes.

remarks.para: GridLayout provides comprehensive grid-based layout capabilities that rival modern CSS Grid and HTML table functionality. It supports column and row definitions with multiple sizing modes including proportional sizing, fixed pixel dimensions, auto-sizing based on content, and star-sizing for flexible space distribution.

Advanced features include:
Row and column spanning for elements that need to occupy multiple grid cells
Individual cell padding control for precise element positioning within cells
Proportional sizing with star notation for responsive column and row widths
Auto-sizing columns and rows based on their content requirements
Stretch modes for filling available horizontal and vertical space
DPI-aware scaling for consistent appearance across different display densities

GridLayout is extensively used for creating complex, table-like layouts such as forms, data entry screens, dashboard layouts, property grids, and any UI where precise row and column control with responsive behavior is required. The layout system automatically handles cell positioning, sizing calculations, and element arrangement based on the defined grid structure and content requirements.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.GridLayout.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a single cell (1x1 grid).
member.remarks: This constructor creates a minimal grid layout with one column and one row, both configured with default sizing behavior. This is ideal for simple layouts that may be expanded later by adding additional rows and columns to the and collections.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.GridLayout.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified number of columns and rows.
member.param: The number of columns to create in the grid. Must be greater than 0.
The number of rows to create in the grid. Must be greater than 0.

remarks.para: This constructor creates a grid layout with the specified dimensions, where all columns and rows are initialized with default sizing behavior. Each column will use automatic sizing unless explicitly configured through the collection, and similarly for rows through the collection.
This is the most efficient way to create a grid when you know the required dimensions in advance, as it pre-allocates the internal collections and avoids dynamic resizing during layout operations.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.GridLayout.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of column definitions that determine the width and sizing behavior of grid columns.
member.value: A of objects that define the grid's column structure.

remarks.para:
Each in this collection represents a column in the grid and provides configuration for width sizing behavior including:
Fixed pixel widths for precise column sizing
Proportional star-sizing for flexible width distribution
Auto-sizing based on column content requirements

Modifying this collection triggers layout invalidation and re-measurement to accommodate the new column structure. The column index of child elements should correspond to valid indices within this collection.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.GridLayout.Rows
member.summary: Gets or sets the collection of row definitions that determine the height and sizing behavior of grid rows.
member.value: A of objects that define the grid's row structure.

remarks.para:
Each in this collection represents a row in the grid and provides configuration for height sizing behavior including:
Fixed pixel heights for precise row sizing
Proportional star-sizing for flexible height distribution
Auto-sizing based on row content requirements

Modifying this collection triggers layout invalidation and re-measurement to accommodate the new row structure. The row index of child elements should correspond to valid indices within this collection.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.GridLayout.DpiScaleChanged(System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Handles DPI scaling changes by invalidating layout measurements and updating the grid structure.
member.param: The scaling factor applied due to DPI changes.

remarks.para:
This method ensures that the grid layout responds appropriately to DPI changes by:
Invalidating existing measurements to force recalculation with new DPI
Triggering a complete layout update to apply DPI-scaled dimensions
Ensuring fixed-size columns and rows are properly scaled
This maintains visual consistency and proper proportions when the application is moved between displays with different DPI settings or when system DPI scaling changes.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.ImageAndTextLayoutPanel
member.summary: Represents a specialized layout panel that arranges two child elements (an image element and a text element) with configurable positioning and alignment.

remarks.para: ImageAndTextLayoutPanel extends LayoutPanel to provide sophisticated layout capabilities specifically designed for image and text combinations commonly found in buttons, menu items, list items, and similar UI elements. The panel can arrange the image and text in various spatial relationships such as side-by-side, stacked, or overlaid configurations.

The layout panel supports different display styles including image-only, text-only, or combined image and text display. Each element can be independently aligned within its allocated space using standard values, and their relative positioning is controlled through the property.
This layout panel is commonly used in controls like buttons, toolstrip items, menu items, and tree nodes where consistent image and text arrangement is required across multiple instances.

remarks.para: The layout calculations automatically adjust based on which elements are visible.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.LayoutPanel
member.summary: Represents the abstract base class for all layout panel elements in the Telerik WinControls framework.

remarks.para: Layout panels are specialized RadElements that serve as containers responsible for arranging and positioning child elements within their boundaries. They implement sophisticated layout algorithms that determine the size, position, and arrangement patterns of primitives and other elements contained within them.

As RadElement derivatives, layout panels can be nested hierarchically to create arbitrarily complex layout structures. This enables the composition of sophisticated UI arrangements such as nested grids, stacked panels with docking behavior, wrapped content within grid cells, and custom layout patterns that combine multiple layout strategies.

Layout panels participate in the WinControls measure and arrange passes, implementing the core layout lifecycle methods MeasureOverride and ArrangeOverride. They integrate seamlessly with the theming system, property inheritance, and the overall element tree structure.

Derived classes implement specific layout algorithms including StackLayout for linear arrangements, DockLayout for edge-based positioning, GridLayout for table-like structures, WrapLayout for flowing content, and other specialized arrangement patterns commonly used in modern UI frameworks.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.StackLayoutPanel
member.summary: Arranges child elements into a single line that can be oriented horizontally or vertically.

remarks.para: StackLayoutPanel provides sophisticated linear layout functionality, allowing elements to be arranged either horizontally or vertically. It supports advanced features including element wrapping when space is exceeded, equal sizing modes, forced element dimensions, and specialized strip mode behavior.

Key capabilities include:
Horizontal and vertical orientation support with automatic layout direction
Element wrapping to new rows or columns when available space is exceeded
Equal sizing modes for creating uniform element dimensions
Right-to-left layout support with automatic content alignment adjustment
Strip mode for single-line layouts without wrapping behavior
Collapse elements on resize for responsive layout behavior

This layout panel is extensively used in toolbars, button panels, menu bars, ribbon controls, and other UI areas where elements need linear arrangement with intelligent space management. The panel automatically handles content alignment, element spacing, and responsive behavior across different screen sizes and orientations.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.UniformGrid
member.summary: Represents a layout panel that arranges child elements in a uniform grid where all cells have equal size.

remarks.para: UniformGrid extends LayoutPanel to provide grid-based layout capabilities where all grid cells are uniformly sized. Unlike regular grids where rows and columns can have different sizes, all cells in a UniformGrid have identical dimensions, calculated by dividing the available space evenly among the specified number of rows and columns.

The grid can be configured with a specific number of rows and columns, or these values can be automatically calculated based on the number of child elements. Child elements can be positioned at specific grid coordinates using attached properties.
UniformGrid is commonly used for displaying items that should have consistent size, such as icon grids, tile layouts, button panels, and other scenarios where visual uniformity is important.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.UniformGrid.ColumnsProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.remarks: This property determines the number of columns in the uniform grid. When set to 0, the number of columns is automatically calculated based on the number of child elements.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.UniformGrid.FirstColumnProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.remarks: This property specifies the first column where child elements should start being placed. This allows for offsetting the grid placement and creating layouts with leading empty cells.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.UniformGrid.RowsProperty
member.summary: Identifies the dependency property.
member.remarks: This property determines the number of rows in the uniform grid. When set to 0, the number of rows is automatically calculated based on the number of child elements.

member.summary: Identifies the column index attached property for child elements.
member.remarks: This attached property allows explicit positioning of child elements at specific column indices within the uniform grid, overriding the default sequential placement.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.UniformGrid.UniformGridRowIndexProperty
member.summary: Identifies the row index attached property for child elements.
member.remarks: This attached property allows explicit positioning of child elements at specific row indices within the uniform grid, overriding the default sequential placement.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.UniformGrid.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns in the uniform grid.
member.value: An integer value representing the number of columns. When set to 0 (default), the number of columns is automatically calculated based on the number of child elements.
member.remarks: Setting this property to a specific value forces the grid to use exactly that many columns, regardless of the number of child elements. Child elements will wrap to new rows as needed.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.Layouts.UniformGrid.Rows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows in the uniform grid.
member.value: An integer value representing the number of rows. When set to 0 (default), the number of rows is automatically calculated based on the number of child elements.
member.remarks: Setting this property to a specific value forces the grid to use exactly that many rows, regardless of the number of child elements. Child elements will wrap to new columns as needed.

member.remarks: This property allows you to offset the placement of child elements, creating empty cells at the beginning of the grid. Child elements will start filling cells from this column index.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.ProgressOrientation
member.summary: Specifies the orientation and direction of progress bar fill animation.
member.remarks: This enumeration defines the direction from which progress bars fill their content area, affecting both the visual orientation and the animation direction of progress indication. Used by progress bar controls and primitives to determine how progress is visually represented.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.ProgressOrientation.Top
member.summary: Specifies that progress fills from top to bottom.
member.remarks: When set to Top, the progress bar displays as a vertical bar that fills downward from the top edge as progress increases.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.ProgressOrientation.Bottom
member.summary: Specifies that progress fills from bottom to top.
member.remarks: When set to Bottom, the progress bar displays as a vertical bar that fills upward from the bottom edge as progress increases.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.ProgressOrientation.Left
member.summary: Specifies that progress fills from left to right.
member.remarks: When set to Left, the progress bar displays as a horizontal bar that fills rightward from the left edge as progress increases. This is the most common progress bar orientation.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.ProgressOrientation.Right
member.summary: Specifies that progress fills from right to left.
member.remarks: When set to Right, the progress bar displays as a horizontal bar that fills leftward from the right edge as progress increases.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadAutoSizeMode
member.summary: Specifies how RadElements automatically size themselves relative to their content and available space.
member.remarks: This enumeration defines different automatic sizing behaviors for RadElements, controlling how they calculate their size based on their content, children, and available space. The sizing mode affects layout calculations and how elements respond to changes in their content or container size.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadAutoSizeMode.FitToAvailableSize
member.summary: Specifies that the element should size itself to fit within the available space provided by its container.
member.remarks: When set to FitToAvailableSize, the element will adjust its size to utilize the space allocated by its parent container or layout manager, potentially stretching or shrinking to match the available dimensions.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadAutoSizeMode.WrapAroundChildren
member.summary: Specifies that the element should size itself to exactly fit around its child elements.
member.remarks: When set to WrapAroundChildren, the element will calculate its size based on the total space required by its child elements, wrapping tightly around them without extra space. This mode is useful for containers that should be exactly as large as their content.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadAutoSizeMode.Auto
member.summary: Specifies automatic sizing behavior that adapts to the element's context and content.
member.remarks: When set to Auto, the element will choose the most appropriate sizing behavior based on its type, content, and container context. This provides intelligent automatic sizing that balances content requirements with available space.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.ElementState
member.summary: Defines the life cycle of a RadElement instance.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.ElementState.Initial
member.summary: The element is in its initial state.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.ElementState.Constructing
member.summary: The element is in a process of being constructed.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.ElementState.Constructed
member.summary: The element is already constructed but not loaded yet.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.ElementState.Loading
member.summary: The element is loading. That is it is initializing on the owning control.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.ElementState.Loaded
member.summary: The element is prepared for visualizing.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.ElementState.Unloaded
member.summary: Special state, indicating that the element has been loaded once and removed from the element tree.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.ElementState.Disposing
member.summary: The element is in a process of being disposed of.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.ElementState.Disposed
member.summary: The element is already disposed of.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadFitToSizeMode
member.summary: Specifies how elements should fit within their parent container's sizing constraints.
member.remarks: This enumeration defines different strategies for fitting child elements within their parent's available space, controlling whether elements should consider content area, padding, or the entire bounds of the parent when determining their size and position.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadFitToSizeMode.FitToParentContent
member.summary: Specifies that the element should fit within the parent's content area, excluding padding and borders.
member.remarks: When set to FitToParentContent, the element will size itself to fit within the available content space of the parent, respecting the parent's padding and border areas.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadFitToSizeMode.FitToParentPadding
member.summary: Specifies that the element should fit within the parent's padding area, including the content area and padding but excluding borders.
member.remarks: When set to FitToParentPadding, the element will size itself to fit within the parent's padding area, which includes both the content area and the padding space, but excludes borders.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadFitToSizeMode.FitToParentBounds
member.summary: Specifies that the element should fit within the entire bounds of the parent, including content, padding, and borders.
member.remarks: When set to FitToParentBounds, the element will size itself to fit within the complete bounds of the parent container, potentially overlapping with the parent's borders and padding areas.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.GestureEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for gesture events that occur when touch or stylus gestures are performed on a control.

remarks.para: GestureEventArgs contains information about touch gestures such as pan, zoom, rotate, and tap operations. It provides access to gesture state, type, and properties needed to implement touch-based interactions in RadControls.
The class exposes gesture timing information (begin/end states), inertia detection, and the ability to mark events as handled to prevent further processing.
This event data is essential for implementing modern touch interfaces and gesture recognition in WinForms applications running on touch-enabled devices.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.GestureEventArgs.Handled
member.summary: [true] if the event has been handled and should not be processed further, [false] otherwise.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.GestureEventArgs.GestureType
member.summary: The type of the gesture that has occurred.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.GestureEventArgs.IsBegin
member.summary: [true] if this is the beginning of the gesture, [false] otherwise.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.GestureEventArgs.IsEnd
member.summary: [true] if this is the end of the gesture, [false] otherwise.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.GestureEventArgs.IsInertia
member.summary: [true] if the event was caused by inertia, [false] otherwise.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.GestureEventArgs.Location
member.summary: The location of the gesture.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.HoveredElementChangedEventHandler
member.summary: Represents the method that will handle the HoveredElementChanged event.
member.param: The source object that raised the event.
The event arguments containing information about the hovered element change.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.HoveredElementChangedEventArgs
member.summary: Provides data for the HoveredElementChanged event that occurs when the mouse hover state changes for an element.

remarks.para: HoveredElementChangedEventArgs is used to notify when the mouse cursor enters or leaves a RadElement, providing the element that is currently under the mouse cursor. This is essential for implementing hover effects, tooltips, and other mouse-based interactions.
The event is commonly used in controls that need to track which specific element the user is hovering over, enabling dynamic visual feedback and contextual information.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.HoveredElementChangedEventArgs.HoveredElement
member.summary: The RadElement that is currently being hovered by the mouse cursor.
member.remarks: This field contains the element that the mouse is currently hovering over. If the mouse is not over any element, this value may be null.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.HoveredElementChangedEventArgs.#ctor(Telerik.WinControls.RadElement)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The RadElement that is currently being hovered, or null if no element is hovered.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Keyboard.ChordMessageFilter.System#Windows#Forms#IMessageFilter#PreFilterMessage(System.Windows.Forms.Message@)
member.summary: Filters out a message before it is dispatched.
member.remarks: Use PreFilterMessage to filter out a message before it is dispatched to a control or form. For example, to stop the Click event of a Button control from being dispatched to the control, you implement the PreFilterMessage method and return a true value when the Click message occurs. You can also use this method to perform code work that you might need to do before the message is dispatched.
member.param: The message to be dispatched. You cannot modify this message.
member.returns: true to filter the message and stop it from being dispatched; false to allow the message to continue to the next filter or control.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadService
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class that provides service capabilities for Telerik WinControls.
member.remarks: Services provide specific functionality that can be registered, started, stopped, and managed through a common interface. They have a lifecycle with states (Initial, Starting, Started, Stopping, Stopped) and support enable/disable functionality with context management.

member.summary: Determines whether the service is operational and may perform actions.

member.param: A context passed to the service.

member.summary: Stops currently working or previously stopped service.
member.param: True to indicate that current operation ended successfully, false otherwise.

member.summary: Pauses a currently running operation.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadService.Resume
member.summary: Resumes previously paused operation.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadService.CanStart(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the service may be started. Validation is as follows: 1. Check whether Enabled is true. 2. Check the context through IsContextValid method. An exception is thrown if context is invalid. 3. Checks the current state - it should be Initial or Stopped.

member.summary: Notifies that a stop request has occured. Cancelable.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentBehavior
member.summary: Manages behavioral aspects of RadControl components including input handling, element selection, keyboard navigation, tooltips, and visual feedback mechanisms.

remarks.para: ComponentBehavior serves as a centralized behavioral controller for RadControl instances, handling complex interactions between the control and its element tree. It manages mouse and keyboard input routing, element selection states, focus management, and various user interface feedback mechanisms.
Key responsibilities include:

item.description: Element capture and selection management
Keyboard navigation and shortcut handling
Tooltip and screen tip presentation
Mnemonic activation and processing
Visual state management (pressed, selected, focused elements)
Resource management for rendering optimizations

remarks.para: The behavior component works closely with the IComponentTreeHandler interface to provide seamless integration between Windows Forms control behavior and the RadElement tree structure.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentBehavior.#ctor(Telerik.WinControls.IComponentTreeHandler)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified component tree handler.
member.param: The that owns this behavior instance.
member.remarks: The constructor establishes the relationship between the behavior manager and its owner component, enabling the behavior to manage input, focus, and visual state for the associated control and its element tree.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentBehavior.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources used by the instance.
member.remarks: This method cleans up managed resources including element references, keyboard mappings, tooltips, screen tip presenters, and shortcut collections. It follows the standard .NET disposal pattern and suppresses finalization.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentBehavior.FocusedElement
member.summary: Gets or sets the currently focused RadElement within the component tree.
member.value: The that currently has input focus, or null if no element is focused.

remarks.para: Setting this property to a specific element will give focus to that element and remove focus from any previously focused element. Setting it to null will remove focus from the currently focused element. This property coordinates with the focus management system to ensure proper focus state handling throughout the element tree.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentBehavior.OnGotFocus(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the event that occurs when the control receives focus, restoring focus to the last focused element.
member.param: An that contains the event data.
member.returns: true if the event is handled; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This method is called when the owner control gains focus. It attempts to restore focus to the element that was previously focused before the control lost focus, maintaining focus continuity for improved user experience.
If a last focused element exists and is not disposed, it becomes the current focused element and receives input focus. The last focused element reference is then cleared.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentBehavior.LastFocusedElement
member.summary: Gets the RadElement that last had focus before the control lost focus. This property is used internally.
member.value: The that was focused when the control lost focus, used for focus restoration.
member.remarks: This property is used internally by the focus management system to restore focus to the appropriate element when the control regains focus. It should not be used directly by application code.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentBehavior.CurrentFocusedElement
member.summary: Gets the RadElement that currently has focus within the component. This property is used internally.
member.value: The that currently has input focus within the component tree.
member.remarks: This property provides direct access to the internally tracked focused element. It is used internally by the focus management system and should not be modified directly by application code. Use the property for programmatic focus management.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentBehavior.OnLostFocus(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Handles the event that occurs when the control loses focus, preserving the focus state for later restoration.
member.param: An that contains the event data.
member.returns: true if the event is handled; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This method is called when the owner control loses focus. It removes focus from the currently focused element and stores a reference to it for later restoration when the control regains focus.
Additionally, if keyboard mapping (key tips) is active, this method resets the key map state to ensure proper cleanup when focus is lost.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentBehavior.IsFocusWithin(Telerik.WinControls.RadElement)
member.summary: Checks is a given element or any of its descendants contain the focus.
member.param: The element.
member.returns: [true] if the element or any of its children contain focus, [false] otherwise.

member.summary: Indicates focus cues display, when available, based on the corresponding control type and the current UI state.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentBehavior.ToolTip
member.summary: Gets the instance used to display element tooltips within the component.
member.value: A instance that handles tooltip display for elements within the component tree. The property creates a instance on first access if one doesn't already exist.

remarks.para: The tooltip is lazily created when first accessed. If the component has a valid element tree with a root element, a is created with that root element as context. Otherwise, a default instance is created.
This tooltip is used throughout the component to display contextual help text for elements that have their property set.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentInputBehavior
member.summary: Extends ComponentBehavior to provide comprehensive input handling capabilities including mouse, keyboard, and gesture input processing for RadControl components.

remarks.para: ComponentInputBehavior specializes in managing all forms of user input for RadControl instances, building upon the base ComponentBehavior functionality. It handles mouse events (clicks, movement, hovering), keyboard input, touch gestures, and coordinates these inputs with the RadElement tree to provide proper event routing and state management.
Key responsibilities include:

item.description: Mouse event routing and element hit testing
Element selection and pressed state management
Mouse capture and release handling
Hover detection and element monitoring
Keyboard input processing and routing
Touch and gesture input handling
Input state coordination across the element hierarchy

remarks.para: The class maintains various input-related states such as which elements are hovered, pressed, or have captured mouse input, ensuring proper visual feedback and interaction behavior throughout the control's element tree.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentInputBehavior.#ctor(Telerik.WinControls.IComponentTreeHandler)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified component tree handler.
member.param: The that owns this input behavior instance.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentThemableElementTree
member.summary: Represents a concrete implementation of RadElementTree that provides comprehensive theming and styling capabilities for Telerik controls, managing theme application and lifecycle within the element hierarchy.

remarks.para: ComponentThemableElementTree extends RadElementTree with complete theming system integration, enabling controls to automatically apply visual themes, respond to runtime theme changes, and participate in application-wide theming infrastructure.
As an , it automatically responds to theme changes and integrates with for theme resolution. Includes animation management with suspension/resume capabilities and sophisticated fallback mechanisms.
Features style versioning for efficient change tracking, application theme integration, and proper resource cleanup through . Used by virtually all Telerik controls for consistent theming behavior.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentThemableElementTree.Theme
member.summary: Gets the currently used theme.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentThemableElementTree.ThemeName
member.summary: Gets or sets control's preffered theme name. Themes are stored and retrieved using APIs of .
member.remarks: If ThemeResolutionService.ApplicatonThemeName refers to a non-empty string, the theme of a RadControl can differ from the one set using RadControls.ThemeName property. If the themes differ, the RadControls.ThemeName property will be overridden by ThemeResolutionService.ApplicatonThemeName. If no theme is registered with a name as ThemeResolutionService.ApplicatonThemeName, then control will revert to the theme specified by its ThemeName property. If ThemeName is assigned to a non-existing theme name, the control may have no visual properties assigned, which will cause it look and behave in unexpected manner. If ThemeName equals empty string, control's theme is set to a theme that is registered within ThemeResolutionService with the name "ControlDefault".

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.ComponentThemableElementTree.ThemeClassName
member.summary: Gets or sets the class name string that ThemeResolutionService will use to find the themes registered for the control.
member.remarks: By default the return value is RadControl's type FullName; Some controls like drop down menu has different ThemeClassName depending on the runtime usage of the control.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.IComponentTreeHandler
member.summary: Defines the contract for handling component tree operations and ambient property management in RadControls.

remarks.para: IComponentTreeHandler extends ILayoutHandler to provide comprehensive component tree management capabilities including element tree creation, initialization, and ambient property handling. This interface is essential for RadControls that need to manage complex element hierarchies.

The interface handles ambient properties (properties that can be inherited from parent controls such as BackColor, ForeColor, and Font), theme management, tooltip support, and focus cues. It provides the foundation for RadControl's element tree architecture.
Implementers are responsible for creating and managing the root element, handling tree loading operations, and coordinating with the layout system to ensure proper rendering and behavior.

member.summary: Updates after a change in an ambient property like BackColor, ForeColor, Font, etc.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.IElementTreeChangeListener
member.summary: Defines methods for receiving notifications about changes in the element tree structure.

remarks.para: IElementTreeChangeListener provides a contract for objects that need to respond to structural changes in the RadElement hierarchy, such as elements being added, removed, or disposed. This is essential for maintaining consistency in complex control scenarios.
Implementers can use these notifications to update internal state, invalidate cached information, or perform cleanup operations when the element tree structure changes.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadItemsControl
member.summary: Provides an abstract base class for RadControls that manage collections of RadItem objects, offering item selection, event handling, and collection management capabilities.

remarks.para: RadItemsControl serves as the foundation for controls that work with collections of interactive items such as list boxes, combo boxes, menus, toolbars, and tree views. It provides a unified programming model for item-based controls through the interface.

The class manages item selection state through and events, coordinates with implementation objects for specialized behavior, and provides infrastructure for item collection management. It delegates specific functionality to implementation classes while maintaining a consistent public interface.

Derived classes include RadListControl, RadComboBox, RadMenu, and other controls that need to manage collections of selectable or interactive items with consistent behavior patterns and event handling throughout the Telerik WinControls framework.

member.name: E:Telerik.WinControls.RadItemsControl.ItemSelected
member.summary: Occurs when an item becomes selected in the control.
member.remarks: This event is raised whenever an item transitions from an unselected to a selected state, providing notification of selection changes to enable responsive user interface updates and business logic execution.

member.name: E:Telerik.WinControls.RadItemsControl.ItemDeselected
member.summary: Occurs when an item becomes deselected in the control.
member.remarks: This event is raised whenever an item transitions from a selected to an unselected state, providing notification of deselection changes to enable cleanup operations and user interface state management.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadControl
member.summary: Serves as the foundational base class for all Telerik WinControls, bridging the Windows Forms framework with the Telerik Presentation Framework (TPF) element-based architecture.

remarks.para: RadControl acts as the host and coordinator for the entire RadElement tree that defines a control's structure and behavior. It inherits from for full Windows Forms compatibility while managing the sophisticated TPF element hierarchy through its .

As an , RadControl manages hosted controls, coordinates focus and DPI scaling, and translates Windows Forms messages into TPF element events. It implements to ensure property changes are communicated to data binding systems.

All RadControls participate in the unified theming system, automatically applying themes to their element trees and responding to runtime theme changes. The control includes comprehensive design-time support for Visual Studio integration and serves as the foundation for RadButton, RadTextBox, RadGridView, and all other Telerik controls.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadControl.GetMonitorDpiScaleFactor(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Gets the DPI scale factor for the monitor where the specified control is currently displayed.
member.param: The control used to determine which monitor to query for DPI information.
member.returns: A representing the DPI scale factor where both Width and Height contain the same scaling value (e.g., 1.25 for 125% scaling, 1.5 for 150% scaling).

remarks.para: This method is used by the RadAutoScale system to determine the target DPI scaling that should be applied to the control. It queries the Windows DPI awareness system to get the effective DPI for the window handle and converts it to a scale factor relative to the standard 96 DPI.
The method is virtual to allow derived controls to customize DPI detection behavior if needed, such as for specialized hosting scenarios or custom DPI handling requirements.
This method requires Windows 10 Anniversary Update (1607) or later for per-monitor DPI awareness support. On earlier versions, the system falls back to other DPI detection methods.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadControl.SetRadAutoScale(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Enables/disables RadAutoScale. If you want to disable RadAutoScale for this control, call this method immediately after creating the control.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadEditorControl
member.summary: Provides an abstract base class for RadControls that support inline editing and advanced layout behaviors, particularly for controls hosted within TableLayoutPanel containers.

remarks.para: RadEditorControl extends RadControl to provide specialized behavior for controls that may be used as editors or within complex layout scenarios. It includes enhanced support for TableLayoutPanel integration, ensuring proper sizing and layout behavior in constrained environments.

The class automatically detects when it's hosted within a TableLayoutPanel and adjusts its sizing behavior accordingly, handling edge cases such as minimized forms and constrained sizing scenarios that can occur in complex layout arrangements.
This abstract class serves as the foundation for various RadControl editors and input controls that require sophisticated layout management and container integration capabilities.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadEditorControl.ImageList
member.summary: Gets or sets the ImageList associated with this control.
member.value: An that contains the images for this control. This property is not typically used in RadEditorControl implementations.
member.remarks: This property is inherited from the base RadControl class but is hidden from the designer and IntelliSense for RadEditorControl implementations, as image lists are typically managed at the element level rather than the control level for editor controls.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadEditorControl.OnParentChanged(System.EventArgs)
member.summary: Raises the event and detects whether the control is hosted within a TableLayoutPanel.
member.param: An that contains the event data.
member.remarks: This method automatically detects when the control is placed within a TableLayoutPanel container and adjusts internal behavior to handle specialized sizing and layout requirements.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadEditorControl.GetPreferredSize(System.Drawing.Size)
member.summary: Retrieves the size of a rectangular area into which a control can be fitted, with special handling for TableLayoutPanel scenarios.
member.param: The custom-sized area for a control.
member.returns: An ordered pair of type representing the width and height of a rectangle.

remarks.para: When the control is hosted within a TableLayoutPanel, this method provides enhanced handling for edge cases where the proposed size has extremely small dimensions (1 pixel or less). In such cases, it requests the preferred size with maximum dimensions to ensure proper sizing calculations.

This specialized behavior prevents sizing issues that can occur in TableLayoutPanel scenarios, particularly when controls are being measured during complex layout operations or when forms are minimized.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadEditorControl.GetRootElementDesiredSize(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the desired size of the root element with enhanced TableLayoutPanel support.
member.param: The x-coordinate for the sizing calculation.
The y-coordinate for the sizing calculation.
The width constraint for the sizing calculation.
The height constraint for the sizing calculation.
member.returns: A structure containing the desired dimensions of the root element.

remarks.para: This method provides specialized sizing behavior when the control is hosted within a TableLayoutPanel. When extremely small dimensions (1 pixel or less) are provided as constraints, the method automatically adjusts the measurement parameters to use maximum values, ensuring accurate size calculations.

The method also includes fallback logic to use the control's current dimensions when the calculated size is invalid or when maximum values are returned, preventing sizing anomalies in complex layout scenarios.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadEditorControl.SetBoundsCore(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Windows.Forms.BoundsSpecified)
member.summary: Sets the specified bounds of the control with special handling for TableLayoutPanel and minimized form scenarios.
member.param: The new x-coordinate of the control.
The new y-coordinate of the control.
The new width of the control.
The new height of the control.
A bitwise combination of values.

remarks.para: This method provides enhanced handling for controls hosted within TableLayoutPanel containers, particularly when the parent form is minimized. It prevents unwanted width changes when the root element is configured to stretch horizontally, maintaining visual consistency during form state transitions.

The method checks for minimized form states and preserves the current width when horizontal stretching is enabled, preventing layout anomalies that can occur during form minimization and restoration cycles.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadElementTree
member.summary: Represents the visual element tree for a Telerik control. Every Telerik control has a corresponding tree of RadElements. This provides flexibility in building controls and enables property inheritance from ancestor nodes.
member.remarks: The RadElementTree manages the hierarchy of visual elements that make up a Telerik control. It handles layout operations, element hit testing, and provides infrastructure for element management and disposal. The tree structure allows for complex visual compositions while maintaining efficient layout and rendering performance.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElementTree.#ctor(Telerik.WinControls.IComponentTreeHandler)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The component tree handler that manages this element tree.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElementTree.InitializeRootElement
member.summary: Initializes the root element of the tree and creates the initial element hierarchy.
member.remarks: This method creates the root element if it doesn't exist, initializes it through the component tree handler, and sets up the initial child elements. It also manages layout suspension during initialization to improve performance.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElementTree.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElementTree.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElementTree.Disposing

member.summary: Gets the root element of the element tree.
member.value: The that serves as the root of the element hierarchy.
member.remarks: The root element is the top-level container for all visual elements in the control. It manages the overall layout and serves as the entry point for element tree operations.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.EffectiveValueEntry
member.summary: Represents an entry in the effective value storage for a dependency property. This structure stores the property index, value, and various flags that indicate the source and state of the property value.
member.remarks: EffectiveValueEntry is used internally by the dependency property system to efficiently store property values along with metadata about their source, animation state, coercion state, and expression bindings. It uses a compact representation to minimize memory usage.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadObject
member.summary: Serves as the foundational base class for all objects in the Telerik Presentation Framework, implementing a sophisticated dependency property system inspired by WPF's property model. RadObject provides the core infrastructure for the TPF property system with multi-layered property values, automatic change notifications, and property inheritance. The system supports multiple value sources with precedence: Local Values (highest), Style Values, Inherited Values, and Default Values. Implements with enhanced RadPropertyChanged events providing detailed change information. Through , it provides custom type information for designer support and property serialization. The property system includes comprehensive APIs (GetValue, SetValue, ResetValue, ClearValue) with priority-based resolution, validation callbacks, and efficient storage. Extends for proper resource cleanup and serves as the foundation for all TPF classes.

member.name: E:Telerik.WinControls.RadObject.RadPropertyChanged
member.summary: Occurs when a value changes, providing enhanced property change information including old and new values, metadata, and value source details specific to the Telerik property system.

member.name: E:Telerik.WinControls.RadObject.RadPropertyChanging
member.summary: Occurs before a value changes, allowing cancellation of the property change operation and providing access to the proposed new value before it is applied.

member.summary: Applies the specified value as Local for the desired property and raises the flag IsLocalValueSetAtDesignTime for that property. All design-time direct property modifications (e.g. item.Text = "Item1") should be done through this method for the property to be properly serialized. If a property is modified through a property grid, the custom property descriptor will automatically apply this logic. This method is used internally. This method is not relevant for this class.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadProperty
member.summary: Represents a dependency property definition in the Telerik Presentation Framework, providing the foundation for the advanced property system that enables theming, styling, inheritance, and data binding throughout the framework.

remarks.para: RadProperty is the core component of TPF's dependency property system, inspired by WPF but tailored for WinForms. Unlike traditional properties, RadProperty supports multiple value sources, property inheritance, change notifications, validation, and coercion.

Properties are registered once per type with metadata defining defaults, inheritance behavior, and callbacks. The value resolution system follows precedence: Local Value, Style Value, Inherited Value, Default Value, with validation and coercion applied throughout the pipeline.

RadProperty maintains strict type safety, supports property inheritance where derived types can override base metadata, and enables efficient property lookup through a global registry. Created through Register(), RegisterAttached(), and AddOwner() factory methods.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadProperty.Register(System.String,System.Type,System.Type,Telerik.WinControls.RadPropertyMetadata)
member.summary: Registers a new dependency property with the specified metadata.
member.param: The name of the property to register.
The type of the property value.
The type that owns this property.
Property metadata including default value, inheritance behavior, and callbacks.
member.returns: A identifier that can be used to set or get property values.
member.remarks: This is the primary method for registering properties that belong to a specific type. The property can be accessed only through instances of the ownerType or its derived types. Use for properties that can be applied to any RadObject.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadProperty.Register(System.String,System.Type,System.Type,Telerik.WinControls.RadPropertyMetadata,Telerik.WinControls.ValidateValueCallback)
member.summary: Registers a new dependency property with metadata and a validation callback.
member.param: The name of the property to register.
The type of the property value.
The type that owns this property.
Property metadata including default value, inheritance behavior, and callbacks.
A callback method to validate property values before they are set.
member.returns: A identifier that can be used to set or get property values.
member.remarks: This overload provides validation capabilities, allowing you to verify property values before they are assigned. The validation callback is called for every value assignment and should return true for valid values, false for invalid ones.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadProperty.RegisterAttached(System.String,System.Type,System.Type,Telerik.WinControls.RadPropertyMetadata)
member.summary: Registers an attached property that can be applied to any RadObject instance.
member.param: The name of the attached property to register.
The type of the property value.
The type that defines this attached property.
Property metadata including default value and callbacks.
member.returns: A identifier for the attached property.
member.remarks: Attached properties are a special kind of property that can be set on any RadObject, not just instances of the ownerType. This is useful for layout properties, styling hints, and other cross-cutting concerns that need to be applied broadly.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadProperty.RegisterAttached(System.String,System.Type,System.Type,Telerik.WinControls.RadPropertyMetadata,Telerik.WinControls.ValidateValueCallback)
member.summary: Registers an attached property with validation capabilities.
member.param: The name of the attached property to register.
The type of the property value.
The type that defines this attached property.
Property metadata including default value and callbacks.
A callback method to validate property values before they are set.
member.returns: A identifier for the attached property.
member.remarks: This overload combines attached property functionality with value validation, ensuring that only valid values can be assigned to the property regardless of which RadObject instance the property is applied to.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadProperty.PropertyType
member.summary: Gets the type of values that can be stored in this property.
member.value: The that represents the data type of this property. All values assigned to this property must be compatible with this type.
member.remarks: This is the type specified when the property was registered through or . The property system uses this type for validation and type checking during value assignment and retrieval operations.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadProperty.Name
member.summary: Gets the name of this property.
member.value: The string name that uniquely identifies this property within its owner type. This is the same name used when registering the property.
member.remarks: Property names must be unique within their owner type hierarchy. The name is used for property lookup operations and debugging. Once a property is registered, its name cannot be changed.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadProperty.OwnerType
member.summary: Gets the type that owns this property definition.
member.value: The that originally registered this property. This is typically the type where the property was first defined, though the property may be inherited by derived types.
member.remarks: The owner type is set when the property is registered through or . Derived types can add metadata through but the original owner type remains unchanged.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadProperty.IsValidValue(System.Object,Telerik.WinControls.RadObject)

member.param: The value to validate.
The RadObject instance where the value would be applied.
member.returns: True if the value is valid; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method performs both type checking and custom validation. It first verifies that the value is compatible with the property type, then calls the ValidateValueCallback if one was specified during property registration.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadProperty.IsValidType(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether the specified value is type-compatible with this property.
member.param: The value to check for type compatibility.
member.returns: True if the value is type-compatible; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method only checks type compatibility and does not invoke custom validation callbacks. Use IsValidValue for complete validation including custom validation logic.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadPropertyMetadata
member.summary: Represents metadata that describes the characteristics and behavior of a RadProperty.

remarks.para: RadPropertyMetadata provides essential information about how a RadProperty behaves, including its default value, change notification callbacks, and various property options.

This metadata is used by the RadProperty system to: - Determine default values for properties - Handle property change notifications - Control property inheritance and coercion - Manage property validation and type conversion
The metadata is typically specified when registering a RadProperty and cannot be changed after the property is registered.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.IExpression
member.summary: Defines a contract for expression objects that can provide dynamic property values and participate in the RadProperty value resolution system.

remarks.para: IExpression enables advanced property value scenarios such as data binding, calculated values, and property value forwarding. Expression objects can provide values that change over time and notify the property system when updates are needed.

Implementations participate in the property value precedence chain and can override local values, inherited values, or default values depending on their configuration and attachment to specific RadObject instances.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.IExpression.GetValue(Telerik.WinControls.RadObject,Telerik.WinControls.RadProperty)
member.summary: Gets the current value for the specified property on the given RadObject.
member.param: The RadObject instance for which to retrieve the property value.
The RadProperty whose value should be retrieved.
member.returns: The current value of the property, or if no value is available.
member.remarks: This method is called by the property system when resolving property values. Implementations should return the appropriate value based on their expression logic or to allow fallback to the next value source.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.IExpression.SetValue(Telerik.WinControls.RadObject,Telerik.WinControls.RadProperty,System.Object)
member.summary: Attempts to set a value through this expression.
member.param: The RadObject on which to set the property value.
The RadProperty to set.
The value to set.
member.returns: true if the expression handled the set operation; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Most expression types are read-only and will return false from this method. Data binding expressions may support two-way binding and return true when they successfully update the underlying data source.

The RadProperty from which the expression is being detached.
member.remarks: This method provides an opportunity for expressions to clean up resources, unsubscribe from events, or perform other cleanup operations when they are no longer providing values for a property.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.AttachedPropertyUsage
member.summary: Specifies the scope where an attached property can be applied and how it affects elements.
member.remarks: Attached properties can be applied to different elements in the hierarchy with varying effects and applicability. This enumeration defines the valid usage patterns for attached properties within the RadProperty system.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.AttachedPropertyUsage.Self
member.summary: Specifies that the attached property applies only to the element it is set on.
member.remarks: When set to Self, the attached property affects only the specific element where it is applied and does not cascade to child or descendant elements.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.AttachedPropertyUsage.Children
member.summary: Specifies that the attached property applies to direct child elements.
member.remarks: When set to Children, the attached property affects the direct child elements of the element where it is applied, but not deeper descendants.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.AttachedPropertyUsage.Descendants
member.summary: Specifies that the attached property applies to all descendant elements.
member.remarks: When set to Descendants, the attached property affects all elements in the subtree rooted at the element where it is applied, cascading through all levels of the hierarchy.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.AttachedPropertyUsage.Anywhere
member.summary: Specifies that the attached property can be applied anywhere in the element tree.
member.remarks: When set to Anywhere, the attached property has no restrictions on where it can be applied and may affect elements based on other criteria defined by the property's specific implementation.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement
member.summary: Represents the fundamental building block of the Telerik Presentation Framework (TPF), serving as the base class for all visual and logical elements that compose Telerik controls.

remarks.para: RadElement is the cornerstone of the TPF architecture, providing the foundation for all user interface elements in Telerik WinControls. Every Telerik control is built as a hierarchical tree of RadElement objects, with the at the top and various child elements forming the visual and logical structure.

Elements participate in a comprehensive property system with inheritance, event routing through the tree, layout participation with measure/arrange phases, and integration with themes and styling. The framework supports primitive elements for rendering (text, borders, fills) and layout panels for arranging children.

All RadElement property changes trigger the method, enabling reactive behavior and coordinated updates throughout the element hierarchy. This forms the foundation for (visual properties), (interaction), and primitive elements.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.ResumeReferenceUpdate
