member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.InvalidateArrange
member.summary: Invalidates the arrangement state of the element, causing it to be re-arranged during the next layout pass.
member.remarks: This overload calls InvalidateArrange(false), invalidating only this element. Use this method when the element's position or arrangement-affecting properties have changed.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.InvalidateArrange(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Invalidates the arrangement state of the element and optionally its children, causing them to be re-arranged during the next layout pass.
member.param: True to invalidate this element and all its children; false for this element only.

remarks.para: InvalidateArrange marks the element as needing arrangement and adds it to the layout manager's arrange queue if layout is not currently suspended. This is typically called when properties that affect the element's position or size have changed.
The method respects the element's state and layout suspension. If layout is suspended, the invalidation is recorded but the element won't be queued for arrangement until layout is resumed.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.InvalidateMeasure
member.summary: Invalidates the measurement state of the element, causing it to be re-measured during the next layout pass.
member.remarks: This overload calls InvalidateMeasure(false), invalidating only this element. Use this method when the element's content or measurement-affecting properties have changed.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.InvalidateMeasure(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Invalidates the measurement state of the element and optionally its children, causing them to be re-measured during the next layout pass.
member.param: True to invalidate this element and all its children; false for this element only.

remarks.para: InvalidateMeasure marks the element as needing measurement and adds it to the layout manager's measure queue if layout is not currently suspended. This is typically called when properties that affect the element's desired size have changed.
The method respects the element's state and layout suspension. If layout is suspended, the invalidation is recorded but the element won't be queued for measurement until layout is resumed.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.UpdateLayout

member.summary: Temporarily suspends layout operations upon this element.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.SuspendLayout(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Temporarily suspends layout operations upon this element.
member.param: True to suspend children also, false otherwise.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.ResumeLayout(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resumes layout logic for the element with an option to force immediate layout.
member.param: True to execute pending layout requests immediately; false to simply resume layout operations.
member.remarks: This overload calls ResumeLayout(false, performLayout), resuming layout for this element only. Use this method after calling SuspendLayout to re-enable layout calculations.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.ResumeLayout(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Resumes layout logic for the element and optionally for its children, with an option to force immediate layout.
member.param: True to resume layout for this element and all its children; false for this element only.
True to execute pending layout requests immediately; false to simply resume layout operations.
member.remarks: Layout operations are reference-counted, so each call to SuspendLayout must be matched with a corresponding call to ResumeLayout. When the suspend count reaches zero and the element is loaded, pending layout operations will be executed if performLayout is true. This method is essential for maintaining element tree layout consistency.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.Arrange(System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Positions and sizes the element within the specified rectangular area.
member.param: The final rectangular area allocated for this element by its parent.

remarks.para: Arrange is a core method in the two-pass layout system (Measure/Arrange). It is called by parent elements to position and size child elements after the Measure pass has determined the desired sizes.

This method handles layout suspension, visibility checks, arranges children through their layout panels, and ensures that layout operations are properly coordinated through the layout manager. It automatically triggers Measure if the element hasn't been measured or if measure data is invalid.
The method validates the finalRect for infinity and NaN values and respects element visibility settings. Collapsed elements skip arrangement but still record their final rectangle for reference.

member.exception: Thrown when finalRect contains infinity or NaN values.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.Measure(System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Calculates the desired size of the element given the specified available space.
member.param: The available space that can be allocated to this element by its parent.

remarks.para: Measure is the first pass of the two-pass layout system (Measure/Arrange). It determines how much space the element would like to occupy based on its content and the constraints provided by its parent.

This method handles layout suspension, validates the availableSize for NaN values, respects element visibility, and coordinates with the layout manager to ensure proper measurement sequencing. The calculated desired size becomes available through the DesiredSize property.
Collapsed elements are given zero desired size but still participate in the measurement process. The method is optimized to avoid redundant measurements when the available size hasn't changed.

member.exception: Thrown when availableSize contains NaN values.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.Size
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the element which is the height and width of the visual rectangle that would contain the graphics of the element. Size corresponds to element's Bounds.Size. When the AutoSize property is set to true setting the Size property to some value has no effect.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.BorderThickness

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.Padding
member.summary: Gets or sets the padding sizes of the element. The paddings are included into the element's bounding rectangle.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.Margin
member.summary: Gets or sets a value corresponding to the margins of the element. Margins are not included into the element's bounding rectangle.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.Alignment

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.AutoSizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the way the element should calculate its , when the property is set to true.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.FitToSizeMode
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating the way element will fill its available size when parent element is calculating element size and location.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the element can respond to user interaction.
member.remarks: By default, if element is currently selected when Enabled set to false, next element would be selected. Values inherits from Parent.Enabled. When a scrollable control is disabled, the scroll bars are also disabled. For example, a disabled multiline textbox is unable to scroll to display all the lines of text.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.Visibility
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating element visibility.
member.remarks: Setting this property affects also the children of the element. Collapsed means the element and its children would not be painted and would not be calculated in the layout. This property has no effect in design-time on objects.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.Class
member.summary: Gets or sets a string value indicating the element visual class name. It's used when a stylesheet has been applied to this element.
member.remarks: Style sheets contain groups of property settings categorized by element type and/or class, thus element "class" is used to determine whether certain style rule would be applied over an element. Generally this property is assigned by the control developer but it can be changed design time or runtime if certain element is decided to have different style class.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.ClipDrawing
member.summary: Indicates whether the painting of the element and its children should be restricted to its bounds.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadElement.Shape
member.summary: Gets or sets an instance of the Shape object of an element. The shape of the element is both responsible for clipping the element's children and for providing its' border(s) with custom shape.
member.remarks: Value of null (or Nothing in VisualBasic.Net) indicates that element has rectangular (or no) shape. Shape is an object that defines the bounding graphics path of an element. Graphics clip is always applied when an element has shape. Shape is considered when painting the border element, and when hit-testing an element. Some predefined shapes are available, like or . offers a way to specify element's shape with a sequence of points and curves using code or the design time .

member.summary: Provides metadata for RadElement properties, including layout and rendering behavior options.
member.remarks: This class extends to provide element-specific property metadata that controls how property changes affect layout, rendering, and inheritance within the element hierarchy. The metadata includes options for invalidating layout, affecting measurements, controlling inheritance, and determining what aspects of the element tree need to be updated when property values change.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadHostItem
member.summary: Represents a RadItem that can host any external Windows Forms control, providing seamless integration between standard Windows Forms controls and the Telerik Presentation Framework.

remarks.para: RadHostItem enables any standard Windows Forms control (such as TextBox, ComboBox, DateTimePicker, or custom user controls) to be embedded within the Telerik element tree, participating in layout management, theming, and event routing while maintaining their native functionality.

The hosted control can be any descendant of the class with no restrictions. RadHostItem handles proper sizing, positioning, and lifecycle management of the hosted control, including focus management, validation events, and parent-child relationship maintenance.

Common use cases include integrating legacy Windows Forms controls into modern Telerik interfaces, hosting specialized controls within Telerik containers, and creating hybrid layouts that combine TPF elements with traditional Windows Forms controls for maximum flexibility.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RadHostItem.RadHostItemLastStateKey
member.summary: This constant is not relevant for this class.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadHostItem.#cctor
member.summary: Initializes the static members of the class.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadHostItem.#ctor(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified control to host.
member.param: The to be hosted within this RadHostItem. This can be any Windows Forms control or custom control.

remarks.para: The constructor automatically synchronizes inheritable properties such as ForeColor, BackColor, and Font between the host item and the hosted control.
If the hosted control is a RadControl, special handling is applied to synchronize properties with the root element rather than the control directly.
Event wiring is automatically established to ensure proper integration between the hosted control and the Telerik element hierarchy.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadHostItem.InitializeFields
member.summary: Initializes the fields of this instance with their default values.

member.summary: Releases managed resources used by this element, including disposing the hosted control.

member.summary: Wires event handlers to the hosted control for proper integration with the RadHostItem.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.RadHostItem.UnwireEvents
member.summary: Unwires event handlers from the hosted control.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadHostItem.HostedControl
member.summary: Gets the instance of the hosted Windows Forms control.
member.value: The instance that is being hosted by this RadHostItem.

remarks.para: This property provides direct access to the Windows Forms control that is hosted within the RadHostItem. The hosted control maintains its native functionality while being integrated into the Telerik element tree.
The hosted control can be any descendant of the class, including standard Windows Forms controls, third-party controls, or custom user controls.
Changes to the hosted control's properties should be made through this property or through the RadHostItem's synchronized properties to ensure proper integration with the TPF framework.

summary.para: Gets or sets whether the mouse and keyboard messages from the hosted control can be routed to the owner control.

remarks.para: You can use ElementTree.Control to get the owner control.
To get the hosted control use HostedControl property.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadHostItem.CausesValidation
member.summary: Gets or sets the CausesValidation property of the hosted control.
member.remarks: Using this property is equivalent to using HostedControl.CausesValidation

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadHostItem.Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the RadHostItem and its hosted control are enabled.
member.value: true if both the RadHostItem and its hosted control are enabled; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: When this property is set, the enabled state is automatically synchronized with the hosted control. Setting this to false will also disable the hosted control, preventing user interaction. If the hosted control supports disabled appearance, it will be rendered accordingly.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.RadHostItem.ClipControl
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that determines whether the hosted control should be clipped when it requires more space than available.
member.value: true if the hosted control should be clipped to fit within the available bounds; otherwise, false. The default value is true.

remarks.para: When set to true, the hosted control will be automatically resized and clipped if it exceeds the available space allocated to the RadHostItem. This ensures the control does not overlap with other elements in the layout.
When set to false, the hosted control can extend beyond the bounds of the RadHostItem, which may cause visual overlap with adjacent elements.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RadItem
member.summary: Represents an interactive element within the Telerik Presentation Framework that can respond to user input, participate in collections, and provide advanced UI behaviors such as selection, focus, and accessibility.

remarks.para: RadItem extends with comprehensive user interaction capabilities, making it the base class for all interactive elements in Telerik controls. It provides mouse, keyboard, and touch gesture support with proper event routing and state management.

The class implements and for drag-and-drop scenarios, participates in ItemsCollection containers for design-time manipulation, and provides accessibility support through proper role definitions and screen reader compatibility.

RadItem includes extensive design-time support, robust text handling with data binding capabilities, and command integration through . It serves as the foundation for interactive elements like buttons, menu items, list items, and tree nodes.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.RootRadElement
member.summary: Represents the top-level element in a RadControl's element hierarchy, serving as the root container and coordination point for all child elements within the Telerik Presentation Framework.

remarks.para: RootRadElement serves as the foundational entry point into the TPF element tree, acting as the bridge between the Windows Forms RadControl host and the element-based architecture. Every RadControl has exactly one RootRadElement accessible through the property.

The root element manages layout coordination with suspension/resumption, property inheritance as the source for cascading properties (fonts, colors, themes), and event routing coordination for both tunneling and bubbling events. It maintains the connection between Windows Forms and TPF systems.
Critical routed events include , , and layout events (, ) that coordinate behavior across the control hierarchy and enable optimized batch operations.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.RootRadElement.RootLayoutResumedEvent
member.summary: Tunnels when the layout has been resumed in order to notify any children that should take special actions in this case - like RadHostItem.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement
member.summary: Extends RadElement with visual properties and rendering capabilities common to all visual elements.

remarks.para: VisualElement serves as the base class for all visually rendered elements in the Telerik WinControls framework. It provides fundamental visual properties such as colors, fonts, opacity, smoothing modes, and other rendering attributes that affect how elements appear on screen.

This class implements the core visual property system, including property inheritance, layout effects, and painting infrastructure. It defines how elements interact with themes, handle DPI scaling, and manage visual states during runtime.
VisualElement is the foundation for all primitive elements, layout panels, and composite controls in the Telerik framework, providing consistent visual behavior and styling capabilities.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.DefaultSizeProperty
member.summary: Identifies the DefaultSize dependency property. This property represents the default size of a VisualElement. When set, this property affects display, parent arrangement, and measurement calculations.
member.remarks: This is an attached property that can be applied to any VisualElement. The default value is Size.Empty. When changed, it will trigger layout recalculation because it has the AffectsDisplay, AffectsParentArrange, and AffectsMeasure property options.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.ForeColorProperty
member.summary: Identifies the ForeColor dependency property. This property represents the foreground color used for rendering text and borders.
member.remarks: This property can inherit its value from parent elements and affects the display of the element when changed.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.BackColorProperty
member.summary: Identifies the BackColor dependency property. This property represents the background color used for filling the element.
member.remarks: This is an attached property that can be inherited through the element tree. Changes to this property will trigger display updates.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.FontProperty
member.summary: Identifies the Font dependency property. This property represents the font used for rendering text.
member.remarks: This property has significant impact on layout and display. Changes to this property will trigger measurement, layout recalculation, and display updates. It can be inherited from parent elements.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.SmoothingModeProperty
member.summary: Identifies the SmoothingMode dependency property. This property determines how graphics are smoothed when rendered.
member.remarks: Changes to this property affect the visual quality of rendered graphics. The default value is SmoothingMode.Default.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.OpacityProperty
member.summary: Identifies the Opacity dependency property. This property determines the transparency level of the element.
member.remarks: The value ranges from 0.0 (completely transparent) to 1.0 (completely opaque). Changes to this property affect how the element and its children are displayed.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.CustomFontProperty
member.summary: Identifies the CustomFont dependency property. This property specifies the name of a custom font to use.
member.remarks: The default value is "None", which means no custom font is used. When set to a valid font name, it overrides the standard Font property.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.CustomFontSizeProperty
member.summary: Identifies the CustomFontSize dependency property. This property specifies the size of the custom font.
member.remarks: The default value is 12.0f. This property is used in conjunction with CustomFont.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.CustomFontStyleProperty
member.summary: Identifies the CustomFontStyle dependency property. This property specifies the style of the custom font.
member.remarks: The default value is FontStyle.Regular. This property is used in conjunction with CustomFont.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.DefaultSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default size for the visual element.
member.remarks: The default size is used as the preferred size when measuring and arranging elements. This property is inheritable through the element tree and affects layout calculations.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.ForeColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the foreground color of the element.
member.value: A that represents the foreground color used for text and borders. The default value is determined by the current theme.
member.remarks: This property is inheritable through the element tree, allowing child elements to inherit the foreground color from their parents unless explicitly overridden. The foreground color affects text rendering and border appearance.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.BackColor
member.summary: Gets or sets the background color of the element.
member.value: A that represents the background color of the element. The default value is determined by the current theme.
member.remarks: This property is inheritable through the element tree, allowing child elements to inherit the background color from their parents unless explicitly overridden.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.Font
member.summary: Gets or sets the font used for rendering text in this element.
member.value: A object that defines the text format including font face, size, and style attributes. The default value is determined by the current theme or system default font.
member.remarks: This property is inheritable through the element tree and has significant impact on layout calculations. Setting the font to null will reset it to the inherited or default value.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.CustomFont
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the custom font to be used for rendering text in this element.
member.remarks: This property works in conjunction with CustomFontSize and CustomFontStyle to define a custom font. Setting this property to a font name other than "None" will override the Font property. Available values include standard fonts like "Roboto" and icon fonts like "Telerik Web UI" and "Font Awesome".

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.CustomFontSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the custom font in points.
member.remarks: This property is used when CustomFont is set to a value other than "None". The default size is 12 points.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.CustomFontStyle
member.summary: Gets or sets the style for the custom font.
member.remarks: This property is used when CustomFont is set to a value other than "None". The default style is Regular, but can be set to other FontStyle values like Bold, Italic, etc.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.SmoothingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the smoothing mode of an element. Smoothing mode enumeration defines possible values.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.VisualElement.Opacity
member.summary: Gets or sets the opacity of an element. Value 0.0f indicates that the element is completely transparent, 1.0f means the element is not transparent (the default value).

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.ControlHelper
member.summary: Provides utility methods for working with Windows Forms controls and window management operations.

remarks.para: ControlHelper contains static helper methods for common control tree operations, window ordering, mouse hit testing, and control hierarchy management. These utilities are used throughout the Telerik WinControls framework for low-level control manipulation.

The class provides functionality for Z-order management, non-client area invalidation, control disposal checking, and mouse position tracking that are essential for advanced control behaviors and window management.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ControlHelper.GetAnyDisposingInHierarchy(System.Windows.Forms.Control)
member.summary: Determines whether any control in the hierarchy from the specified child control up to the root is disposing or disposed.
member.param: The starting control to check, along with its parent hierarchy.
member.returns: true if any control in the hierarchy is disposed or currently disposing; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This method walks up the control hierarchy from the specified child control to the root, checking each control's and properties. It's useful for determining whether it's safe to perform operations on a control.
This check is important in scenarios where controls might be disposed asynchronously or where you need to ensure that parent controls are still valid before performing operations.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ControlHelper.GetControlUnderMouse
member.summary: Gets the Windows Forms control that is currently under the mouse cursor.
member.returns: The instance under the mouse cursor, or null if no control is found.

remarks.para: This method uses the current mouse position and Windows API calls to determine which control the mouse is currently over. It first gets the window handle at the mouse position using WindowFromPoint, then converts that handle to a managed Control reference.
This is useful for drag-and-drop operations, hit testing, and determining context for mouse-related operations when you need to identify the target control dynamically.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ControlHelper.BringToFront(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Brings a window to the front of the Z-order, optionally activating it.
member.param: The window handle to bring to front.
true to activate the window (give it focus); false to only change its Z-order position.

remarks.para: This method positions the specified window at the top of the Z-order stack, making it visible above all other windows. When is true, the window also receives focus and becomes the active window.
This is commonly used for bringing popup windows, dialogs, or notification windows to the user's attention without necessarily stealing focus from the current application.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ControlHelper.SendToBack(System.IntPtr,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sends a window to the back of the Z-order, optionally activating it.
member.param: The window handle to send to back.
true to activate the window; false to only change its Z-order position.

remarks.para: This method positions the specified window at the bottom of the Z-order stack, making it appear behind all other windows. This is typically used to minimize the visual impact of background windows or utility windows.
Note that activating a window that's sent to back may cause visual inconsistencies, so is usually set to false for this operation.

member.summary: Forces the non-client area of the specified Control instance to be re-evaluated.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.CursorHelper
member.summary: Provides utility methods for creating and managing custom cursors with DPI scaling support.

remarks.para: CursorHelper contains static methods for creating custom cursors from bitmaps and managing DPI-aware cursor scaling. It includes functionality for creating cursors with custom hot spots and provides built-in flipped arrow cursors optimized for different DPI settings.

Key features include:
Custom cursor creation from bitmap images with configurable hot spots
DPI-aware cursor scaling for high-resolution displays
Built-in flipped arrow cursor with automatic scaling
Cursor caching to improve performance and memory usage
SVG-based cursor generation for crisp rendering at any scale
This class is essential for applications that need custom cursors or DPI-aware cursor behavior, particularly in high-DPI environments where standard cursors may appear too small or pixelated.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.CursorHelper.CursorFromBitmap(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Point)
member.summary: Creates a custom cursor from a bitmap image with the specified hot spot.
member.param: The bitmap image to use as the cursor appearance.
The point within the bitmap that represents the cursor's active point.
member.returns: A new instance created from the bitmap with the specified hot spot.

remarks.para:
This method converts a bitmap image into a Windows cursor by:
Converting the bitmap to an icon handle using GetHicon
Retrieving and modifying the icon information
Setting the custom hot spot coordinates
Creating the final cursor using CreateIconIndirect
The hot spot determines which pixel of the cursor image corresponds to the precise mouse position. For example, an arrow cursor typically has its hot spot at the tip of the arrow.
The caller is responsible for disposing of the returned cursor when it's no longer needed.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.CursorHelper.FlippedArrowCursor
member.summary: Gets a flipped arrow cursor optimized for 96 DPI (standard resolution).
member.value: A representing a flipped arrow cursor at standard 96 DPI resolution.

remarks.para: This property provides quick access to a flipped arrow cursor designed for standard DPI settings. The cursor is ideal for indicating reverse or opposite directional operations in the user interface.
For high-DPI scenarios, use instead to ensure proper scaling.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.CursorHelper.GetScaledFlippedArrowCursor(System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Gets a flipped arrow cursor scaled to the specified DPI scaling factor.
member.param: The scaling factor to apply to the cursor (e.g., 1.5 for 150% DPI scaling).
member.returns: A representing a flipped arrow cursor scaled for the specified DPI.

remarks.para:
This method provides DPI-aware flipped arrow cursors by:
Loading the cursor from an embedded SVG resource for scalable rendering
Caching cursors for each unique scaling factor to improve performance
Calculating the appropriate size and hot spot based on the scaling factor
Generating a bitmap at the target resolution for crisp appearance
The cursor uses SVG-based rendering to ensure sharp, clean appearance at any DPI setting. The hot spot is automatically scaled to maintain proper cursor behavior across different resolutions.
Cursors are cached per scaling factor, so subsequent calls with the same scaling value return the cached cursor for optimal performance.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.DoubleUtil
member.summary: Provides utility methods for floating-point number comparisons and operations with epsilon tolerance.

remarks.para: DoubleUtil addresses the common problem of floating-point precision errors by providing comparison methods that use an epsilon tolerance value. This is essential for reliable comparisons in graphics and layout calculations where small rounding errors can occur.

The class provides methods for comparing float values, points, rectangles, and sizes with appropriate tolerance for equality, greater-than, and less-than operations. It also includes utility methods for safe float-to-integer conversion.
This utility is used throughout the Telerik WinControls framework for layout calculations, hit testing, and other operations that require robust floating-point comparisons.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.DoubleUtil.AreClose(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Determines whether two float values are close enough to be considered equal within epsilon tolerance.
member.param: The first float value to compare.
The second float value to compare.
member.returns: true if the values are close enough to be considered equal; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method accounts for floating-point precision errors by using an epsilon tolerance value that adjusts based on the magnitude of the numbers being compared.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.DoubleUtil.AreClose(System.Drawing.PointF,System.Drawing.PointF)
member.summary: Determines whether two PointF structures are close enough to be considered equal within epsilon tolerance.
member.param: The first PointF to compare.
The second PointF to compare.
member.returns: true if both X and Y coordinates are close enough to be considered equal; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.DoubleUtil.AreClose(System.Drawing.RectangleF,System.Drawing.RectangleF)
member.summary: Determines whether two RectangleF structures are close enough to be considered equal within epsilon tolerance.
member.param: The first RectangleF to compare.
The second RectangleF to compare.
member.returns: true if all rectangle properties (X, Y, Width, Height) are close enough to be considered equal; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Empty rectangles are compared for exact emptiness rather than using epsilon tolerance.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.DoubleUtil.AreClose(System.Drawing.SizeF,System.Drawing.SizeF)
member.summary: Determines whether two SizeF structures are close enough to be considered equal within epsilon tolerance.
member.param: The first SizeF to compare.
The second SizeF to compare.
member.returns: true if both Width and Height values are close enough to be considered equal; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method compares both the Width and Height properties of the size structures using epsilon tolerance to account for floating-point precision errors.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.DoubleUtil.DoubleToInt(System.Single)
member.summary: Converts a float value to an integer using proper rounding.
member.param: The float value to convert.
member.returns: The rounded integer value.

remarks.para: This method performs proper rounding by adding or subtracting 0.5 based on the sign of the value before truncating to integer. This ensures consistent rounding behavior compared to simple casting.
For positive values, 0.5 is added before truncation. For negative values, 0.5 is subtracted. This provides symmetrical rounding around zero.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.DoubleUtil.GreaterThan(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Determines whether the first value is greater than the second value with epsilon tolerance.
member.param: The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.
member.returns: true if is greater than and they are not close enough to be equal; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method returns true only if value1 is definitively greater than value2, taking into account floating-point precision. Values that are close enough to be considered equal will return false.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.DoubleUtil.GreaterThanOrClose(System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Determines whether the first value is greater than or approximately equal to the second value.
member.param: The first value to compare.
The second value to compare.
member.returns: true if is greater than or they are close enough to be considered equal; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method returns true if value1 is either definitively greater than value2 or if they are close enough to be considered equal within epsilon tolerance.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.DoubleUtil.IsBetweenZeroAndOne(System.Single)
member.summary: Determines whether a value is between 0 and 1 (inclusive) using epsilon tolerance.
member.param: The value to check.
member.returns: true if the value is greater than or equal to 0 and less than or equal to 1 (within epsilon tolerance); otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method is commonly used for validating normalized values, percentages, and alpha values that should be constrained to the 0-1 range.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.DoubleUtil.IsOne(System.Single)
member.summary: Determines whether a float value is approximately equal to 1.0 within epsilon tolerance.
member.param: The value to check.
member.returns: true if the value is close enough to 1.0 to be considered equal; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method uses a tighter epsilon tolerance (10 times the base epsilon) to determine if a value represents unity, accounting for floating-point precision errors.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.DoubleUtil.IsZero(System.Single)
member.summary: Determines whether a float value is approximately equal to 0.0 within epsilon tolerance.
member.param: The value to check.
member.returns: true if the value is close enough to 0.0 to be considered equal; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: This method uses a tighter epsilon tolerance (10 times the base epsilon) to determine if a value represents zero, accounting for floating-point precision errors.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.Formatter
member.summary: Provides formatting and parsing utilities for converting between different data types with support for culture-specific formatting and null value handling.
member.remarks: This class offers comprehensive functionality for data binding scenarios where values need to be converted between types while respecting formatting rules and culture settings. Supports nullable types, TypeConverter integration, and special handling for CheckState conversions.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Formatter.#cctor

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Formatter.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.remarks: This constructor creates a new Formatter instance. However, most operations are provided as static methods, so instance creation is typically not necessary.

member.returns: true if the values are considered equal; otherwise, false.

The type to format the value to.
Optional custom TypeConverter for the source type.
Optional custom TypeConverter for the target type.
Optional format string for IFormattable objects.

The value to return when the source value represents null.
The value that represents null in the data source.
member.returns: The formatted value as the target type.
member.exception: Thrown when the formatting operation cannot be completed.

The target type that the conversion was attempting to reach.
member.returns: A formatted error message describing the conversion failure.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.Formatter.GetDefaultDataSourceNullValue(System.Type)
member.summary: Gets the default null value representation for the specified type in data source contexts.
member.param: The type to get the default null value for.
member.returns: null for reference types; for value types.

remarks.para: This method determines the appropriate null value representation based on the type. Reference types use null as their null representation, while value types use since they cannot be assigned null directly.
This is commonly used in data binding scenarios where the data source needs to represent null values in a type-appropriate manner.

example.code: object nullValue1 = Formatter.GetDefaultDataSourceNullValue(typeof(string)); // returns null object nullValue2 = Formatter.GetDefaultDataSourceNullValue(typeof(int)); // returns DBNull.Value object nullValue3 = Formatter.GetDefaultDataSourceNullValue(typeof(DateTime)); // returns DBNull.Value

member.returns: A CultureInfo object for formatting operations.
member.remarks: This helper method ensures that formatting operations always have access to appropriate culture information, falling back to the current culture when no specific culture is provided.

The type to parse the string into.
The format provider for culture-specific parsing.
member.returns: The parsed value if a suitable Parse method was found and executed successfully; otherwise, a sentinel value indicating that no Parse method was found.
member.exception: Thrown when the Parse method execution fails.
member.remarks: Uses reflection to find and invoke Parse methods, searching for Parse(string, NumberStyles, IFormatProvider), Parse(string, IFormatProvider), and Parse(string) in that order of preference.

The value that represents null in the data source context.
member.returns: true if the value represents null data; otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This method provides flexible null detection that goes beyond simple null checking. It considers both standard null representations (null and DBNull.Value) and custom null value representations defined by the data source.
This is particularly useful in data binding scenarios where different data sources may use different conventions for representing null or missing values.

For nullable types, null is preferred when the data source uses null or DBNull.Value. For non-nullable types, the data source's null value representation is used.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.HyperlinkHelper
member.summary: Provides utility methods for validating, processing, and handling hyperlinks within Telerik controls.
member.remarks: Supports validation of HTTP/HTTPS URLs, FTP links, mailto addresses, UNC paths, OneNote links, and web URLs using both URI scheme validation and pattern matching approaches.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.HyperlinkHelper.UrlPattern
member.summary: Regular expression pattern for validating URLs and various hyperlink formats. Matches HTTP/HTTPS/FTP URLs, mailto links, UNC paths, OneNote links, and www addresses.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.HyperlinkHelper.MailPattern
member.summary: Regular expression pattern for validating email addresses. Matches standard email format with domain validation.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.HyperlinkHelper.ValidateLinkScheme(System.String)
member.summary: Validates a hyperlink using strict URI scheme validation to ensure it conforms to standard URI formats.
member.param: The hyperlink string to validate.
member.returns: true if the hyperlink is a valid absolute URI with an HTTP, HTTPS, or mailto scheme; otherwise, false.
member.remarks: Performs strict validation using the .NET Uri class. Only accepts URLs with HTTP, HTTPS, or mailto schemes. More restrictive than ValidateLinkPattern and should be used when strict validation is required.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.HyperlinkHelper.ValidateLinkPattern(System.String)
member.summary: Validates a hyperlink using regular expression pattern matching to support a broader range of link formats.
member.param: The hyperlink string to validate against the supported patterns.
member.returns: true if the hyperlink matches any of the supported patterns (URL patterns or email patterns); otherwise, false.

remarks.para: This method provides more flexible validation than by using regular expression patterns to match various hyperlink formats. It supports:

item.description: HTTP and HTTPS URLs (with or without www prefix)
FTP URLs
Mailto links
UNC paths (\\server\path)
OneNote links
Web addresses starting with www
Email addresses

remarks.para: This validation is more permissive than URI scheme validation and is useful for scenarios where you want to accept a wider variety of link formats, including those that might need preprocessing before being used as actual URLs.

example.code:
// Valid patterns bool result1 = HyperlinkHelper.ValidateLinkPattern("https://example.com"); // returns true bool result2 = HyperlinkHelper.ValidateLinkPattern("www.example.com"); // returns true bool result3 = HyperlinkHelper.ValidateLinkPattern("user@example.com"); // returns true bool result4 = HyperlinkHelper.ValidateLinkPattern("\\\\server\\share"); // returns true bool result5 = HyperlinkHelper.ValidateLinkPattern("onenote:page-link"); // returns true
// Invalid patterns bool result6 = HyperlinkHelper.ValidateLinkPattern("just text"); // returns false bool result7 = HyperlinkHelper.ValidateLinkPattern(""); // returns false

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.HyperlinkHelper.ShowMessage(System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Displays a warning message box to the user with hyperlink-related information.
member.param: The hyperlink that is associated with the message, which will be appended to the message text.
The message text to display to the user, typically describing the issue or validation result.
The caption text for the message box title bar.
member.remarks: Shows hyperlink-related messages with a warning icon and OK button. The hyperlink parameter is appended to the message text so users can see exactly which link caused the issue.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.ImageHelper
member.summary: Provides utility methods for image manipulation, processing, and conversion operations.
member.remarks: Contains static methods for common image operations including alpha blending, masking, cropping, format conversion, and pixel-level manipulations. Supports various image formats and provides efficient bitmap manipulation methods using unsafe code for performance-critical operations.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ImageHelper.ApplyAlpha(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Single)
member.summary: Applies a uniform alpha (transparency) value to all pixels in the specified bitmap.
member.param: The bitmap to modify. Must be in 32bpp ARGB format.
The alpha value to apply, ranging from 0.0 (fully transparent) to 1.0 (fully opaque).
member.remarks: Directly modifies the alpha channel of each pixel using unsafe code for optimal performance. The bitmap must be in 32bpp ARGB format. Commonly used for fade effects and transparency adjustments.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ImageHelper.ApplyMask(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Brush)
member.summary: Applies a brush-based alpha mask to a bitmap, modifying the transparency of pixels based on the brush pattern.
member.param: The bitmap to apply the mask to.
The brush defining the alpha mask pattern. The brush's color values determine the transparency.

remarks.para: This method creates a temporary bitmap filled with the specified brush pattern, then uses the red channel values from this pattern as alpha values for the original bitmap. This allows for complex transparency effects based on gradients, patterns, or solid colors.

The masking process:
Creates a temporary bitmap the same size as the original
Fills the temporary bitmap with the brush pattern
Uses the red channel values as alpha channel values for each corresponding pixel
This is useful for creating fade effects, vignettes, and complex transparency patterns.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ImageHelper.Crop(System.Drawing.Bitmap,System.Drawing.Rectangle)
member.summary: Crops a rectangular region from a bitmap and returns it as a new bitmap with high-quality rendering.
member.param: The source bitmap to crop from.
The rectangular region to extract from the source image, in pixel coordinates.
member.returns: A new containing the cropped region, with dimensions matching the crop rectangle.

remarks.para:
This method creates a new bitmap with the exact dimensions of the crop rectangle and draws the specified region from the source image using high-quality rendering settings:
Anti-aliased smoothing for clean edges
High-quality bicubic interpolation for smooth scaling
High-quality pixel offset mode for precise positioning
The crop rectangle coordinates are relative to the source image. If the rectangle extends beyond the source image boundaries, the out-of-bounds areas will be filled with transparent pixels.
The caller is responsible for disposing of the returned bitmap when no longer needed.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ImageHelper.GetClipboardImage

member.param: The image to copy.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.MeasurementGraphics
member.summary: Provides a lightweight graphics context optimized for measurement operations without rendering. Uses a shared memory device context for better performance than creating new graphics contexts.
member.remarks: Thread-safe implementation with thread-static fields ensuring each thread has its own memory DC. Uses reference counting to manage the lifetime of the memory device context.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.MeasurementGraphics.controlCount
member.summary: Thread-static field that tracks the number of controls using the measurement graphics on the current thread. Used for reference counting to determine when to release the memory device context.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.MeasurementGraphics.memoryDC
member.summary: Thread-static field that holds the handle to the memory device context for the current thread. This DC is shared across all MeasurementGraphics instances on the same thread.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.MeasurementGraphics.instance
member.summary: Synchronization object used for thread-safe operations.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.MeasurementGraphics.SyncObject
member.summary: Gets the synchronization object used for thread-safe operations when working with measurement graphics.
member.value: A synchronization object that can be used for locking critical sections.
member.remarks: Use this object when you need to synchronize access to measurement graphics operations across multiple threads or when performing operations that require atomic access.

member.name: F:Telerik.WinControls.MeasurementGraphics.graphics
member.summary: The graphics object associated with the memory device context.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.MeasurementGraphics.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. Creates or reuses a memory device context for measurement operations.
member.remarks: This constructor creates a memory-compatible device context if one doesn't already exist for the current thread, then creates a Graphics object from that device context. The memory DC is shared across all instances on the same thread for performance.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.MeasurementGraphics.Graphics
member.summary: Gets the Graphics object associated with this measurement graphics context.
member.value: A Graphics object backed by a memory device context for measurement operations such as measuring text size or calculating drawing dimensions.
member.remarks: This Graphics object can be used for measurement operations without requiring a visible drawing surface. Do not dispose this Graphics object manually as it is managed by the MeasurementGraphics instance.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.MeasurementGraphics.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.

remarks.para: This implementation of Dispose does not actually release resources immediately. The underlying memory device context is managed through reference counting using the and methods.
The memory device context is automatically released when the last control on the current thread decreases the control count to zero.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.MeasurementGraphics.CreateMeasurementGraphics
member.summary: Creates a new instance of for performing measurement operations.
member.returns: A new instance that provides access to a graphics context optimized for measurement operations.
member.remarks: Factory method for creating MeasurementGraphics instances. The returned instance should be disposed when no longer needed, preferably using a using statement.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.MeasurementGraphics.IncreaseControlCount
member.summary: Increases the control count for the current thread, indicating that another control is using the measurement graphics functionality.
member.remarks: Used internally for reference counting the shared memory device context. Each control should call this when starting to use measurement graphics.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.MeasurementGraphics.DecreaseControlCount
member.summary: Decreases the control count for the current thread and releases the memory device context if no controls are using it anymore.
member.remarks: Used internally for reference counting. When the count reaches zero, the memory device context is automatically released. Should be called when controls no longer need measurement graphics.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.ReflectionHelper
member.summary: Provides utility methods for reflection-based operations including object cloning and field copying.

remarks.para: ReflectionHelper encapsulates common reflection-based functionality used throughout the Telerik WinControls framework for object manipulation, cloning, and field copying operations. It provides safe, efficient methods for copying object state while respecting serialization attributes and type constraints.

Key features include:
Shallow cloning of objects with automatic field copying
Selective field copying that respects NonSerialized attributes
Delegate field exclusion to prevent event handler copying issues
Integration with IRadCloneable interface for custom clone notifications
Type-safe generic methods for compile-time type checking

This class is essential for creating object copies in scenarios like property inheritance, theme copying, and control state duplication where manual field-by-field copying would be error-prone and maintenance-intensive.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ReflectionHelper.CopyFields``1(``0,``0)
member.summary: Copies all compatible fields from a source object to a target object using reflection.
member.typeparam: The type of both source and target objects.
member.param: The destination object that will receive the copied field values.
The source object from which field values will be copied.

remarks.para:
This method performs a shallow copy of all instance fields (public and non-public) from the source to the target object, with the following exclusions:
Fields marked with the are skipped
Delegate-type fields are skipped to prevent event handler copying issues
Reference type fields are copied by reference, meaning both objects will share the same reference to complex objects. This is a shallow copy operation, not a deep clone.
If the target object implements , the method is called after the field copying process completes, allowing for custom post-copy logic.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ReflectionHelper.Clone``1(``0)
member.summary: Creates a new instance of the specified type and copies all compatible fields from the source object.
member.typeparam: The type to clone. Must be a class with a parameterless constructor.
member.param: The source object to clone.
member.returns: A new instance of type with field values copied from the source object.

remarks.para:
This method performs a shallow clone operation by:
Creating a new instance using the parameterless constructor
Copying all compatible fields using
Notifying the clone if it implements
The cloned object shares references to the same objects as the source for reference-type fields. This is a shallow copy, not a deep clone of the object graph.
If the cloned object implements , both and methods are called to allow for custom initialization logic.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.IRadCloneable
member.summary: Provides notifications during reflection-based cloning and field copying operations.

remarks.para: IRadCloneable extends the standard interface to provide additional notifications during reflection-based operations performed by . This allows objects to perform custom initialization or cleanup logic during cloning processes.

Classes implementing this interface can:
React to field copying completion with
Perform final initialization with
Handle custom logic that requires awareness of the cloning process
This interface is particularly useful for objects that need to reinitialize calculated properties, establish new event handlers, or perform other setup tasks after being cloned.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.IRadCloneable.OnFieldsCopied
member.summary: Called after fields have been copied to this object during a reflection-based field copying operation.

remarks.para:
This method is invoked by after all compatible fields have been copied from a source object. Implementing classes can use this notification to:
Update calculated or derived properties
Reinitialize collections or event handlers
Perform validation or consistency checks
Execute any logic that depends on the complete field state
This method is called before in clone operations, allowing for staged initialization logic.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.IRadCloneable.OnCloneComplete
member.summary: Called after a complete cloning operation has finished, including field copying and any intermediate notifications.

remarks.para:
This method is invoked by as the final step in the cloning process, after all fields have been copied and has been called. Implementing classes can use this notification to:
Perform final initialization that requires all fields to be set
Establish connections or relationships with other objects
Execute validation logic on the complete cloned state
Initialize transient state that shouldn't be copied
This is the last method called during the clone operation, making it ideal for final setup tasks.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.ResourceHelper
member.summary: Provides utility methods for loading and manipulating embedded assembly resources.

remarks.para: ResourceHelper contains static methods for accessing embedded resources from assemblies, particularly images and cursors that are embedded as manifest resources. It provides safe resource loading with proper exception handling and resource disposal.

Key features include:
Safe loading of embedded bitmap images with automatic memory management
Cursor creation from embedded cursor resource files
Proper exception handling with debug output for troubleshooting
Automatic resource stream disposal to prevent memory leaks
Assembly-based resource resolution using type information
This class is commonly used throughout Telerik controls for loading embedded images, icons, cursors, and other resources that are compiled into the assembly as manifest resources.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ResourceHelper.ImageFromResource(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new bitmap image from an embedded resource in the assembly containing the specified type.
member.param: A type from the assembly that contains the embedded resource.
The fully qualified name of the embedded resource (including namespace).
member.returns: A new instance loaded from the embedded resource, or null if the resource could not be found or loaded.

remarks.para:
This method safely loads a bitmap image from an embedded manifest resource by:
Obtaining the assembly from the specified type
Opening a stream to the manifest resource
Creating a temporary bitmap from the stream
Creating a new bitmap copy to ensure proper memory management
Disposing of temporary resources and streams

The resource name should include the full namespace path. For example, if an image is in the "Resources" folder of a project with namespace "MyProject", the resource name would be "MyProject.Resources.image.png".
Exception handling ensures that any loading errors are logged to debug output, and all resources are properly disposed of regardless of success or failure.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.ResourceHelper.CursorFromResource(System.Type,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new cursor from an embedded resource in the assembly containing the specified type.
member.param: A type from the assembly that contains the embedded resource.
The fully qualified name of the embedded cursor resource (including namespace).
member.returns: A new instance loaded from the embedded resource, or null if the resource could not be found or loaded.

remarks.para:
This method safely loads a cursor from an embedded manifest resource by:
Obtaining the assembly from the specified type
Opening a stream to the manifest resource
Creating a cursor directly from the stream
Ensuring proper resource disposal regardless of outcome
The resource should be a valid cursor file (.cur) embedded as a manifest resource. The resource name should include the full namespace path, similar to other embedded resources.
Exception handling ensures that any loading errors are logged to debug output for troubleshooting, while maintaining application stability by returning null on failure.

member.name: T:Telerik.WinControls.TelerikAlignHelper
member.summary: Provides static utility methods for alignment and positioning calculations in Telerik WinControls.

remarks.para: TelerikAlignHelper contains specialized methods for converting between different alignment systems used in Windows Forms and GDI+ rendering. It handles the complexities of translating ContentAlignment values to various string formatting systems, managing right-to-left (RTL) layout transformations, and determining text-image spatial relationships.

Key functionality includes:
ContentAlignment to TextFormatFlags conversion for GDI text rendering
ContentAlignment to StringAlignment conversion for GDI+ text rendering
Right-to-left layout support with automatic alignment translation
TextImageRelation determination based on content alignment values
Spatial relationship calculations for image and text positioning
This class is essential for maintaining consistent text and image alignment across different rendering contexts while properly supporting international layouts and accessibility requirements.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.TelerikAlignHelper.TranslateAlignmentForGDI(System.Drawing.ContentAlignment)
member.summary: Converts a value to the corresponding for vertical text alignment in GDI rendering.
member.param: The content alignment value to convert.

remarks.para: This method extracts the vertical component of a ContentAlignment and translates it to the appropriate TextFormatFlags for use with GDI text rendering methods like TextRenderer.DrawText.

The conversion logic:
BottomLeft, BottomCenter, BottomRight TextFormatFlags.Bottom
MiddleLeft, MiddleCenter, MiddleRight TextFormatFlags.VerticalCenter
TopLeft, TopCenter, TopRight TextFormatFlags.GlyphOverhangPadding (default)

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.TelerikAlignHelper.TranslateLineAlignmentForGDI(System.Drawing.ContentAlignment)
member.summary: Converts a value to the corresponding for horizontal text alignment in GDI rendering.
member.param: The content alignment value to convert.

remarks.para: This method extracts the horizontal component of a ContentAlignment and translates it to the appropriate TextFormatFlags for use with GDI text rendering methods.

The conversion logic:
TopRight, MiddleRight, BottomRight TextFormatFlags.Right
TopCenter, MiddleCenter, BottomCenter TextFormatFlags.HorizontalCenter
TopLeft, MiddleLeft, BottomLeft TextFormatFlags.GlyphOverhangPadding (default)

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.TelerikAlignHelper.TranslateAlignment(System.Drawing.ContentAlignment)
member.summary: Converts a value to the corresponding for horizontal alignment in GDI+ rendering.
member.param: The content alignment value to convert.

remarks.para: This method extracts the horizontal component of a ContentAlignment and translates it to the appropriate StringAlignment for use with GDI+ text rendering methods like Graphics.DrawString.

The conversion logic:
TopRight, MiddleRight, BottomRight StringAlignment.Far
TopCenter, MiddleCenter, BottomCenter StringAlignment.Center
TopLeft, MiddleLeft, BottomLeft StringAlignment.Near

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.TelerikAlignHelper.TranslateLineAlignment(System.Drawing.ContentAlignment)
member.summary: Converts a value to the corresponding for vertical line alignment in GDI+ rendering.
member.param: The content alignment value to convert.

remarks.para: This method extracts the vertical component of a ContentAlignment and translates it to the appropriate StringAlignment for use with GDI+ text rendering methods as the LineAlignment property.

The conversion logic:
BottomLeft, BottomCenter, BottomRight StringAlignment.Far
MiddleLeft, MiddleCenter, MiddleRight StringAlignment.Center
TopLeft, TopCenter, TopRight StringAlignment.Near

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.TelerikAlignHelper.RtlTranslateContent(System.Drawing.ContentAlignment)
member.summary: Translates a value for right-to-left (RTL) layout by flipping horizontal alignments.
member.param: The content alignment value to translate for RTL layout.
member.returns: The translated with horizontal alignment flipped: left alignments become right alignments and vice versa, while center and non-horizontal alignments remain unchanged.

remarks.para: This method is essential for supporting right-to-left languages and layouts. It automatically flips horizontal alignments while preserving vertical alignment information.

Translation examples:
TopLeft TopRight
MiddleLeft MiddleRight
BottomLeft BottomRight
Center alignments and non-horizontal alignments remain unchanged
This method is commonly used in RTL-aware controls to automatically adjust alignment behavior based on the current reading direction.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.TelerikAlignHelper.RtlTranslateRelation(System.Windows.Forms.TextImageRelation)
member.summary: Translates a value for right-to-left (RTL) layout by flipping horizontal relationships.
member.param: The text-image relation to translate for RTL layout.
member.returns: The translated with horizontal relationships flipped: ImageBeforeText becomes TextBeforeImage and vice versa, while other relations remain unchanged.

remarks.para: This method ensures that text-image relationships are properly adjusted for right-to-left layouts. In RTL languages, the concept of "before" and "after" is reversed horizontally.

Translation logic:
ImageBeforeText TextBeforeImage
TextBeforeImage ImageBeforeText
All other relations (vertical or overlay) remain unchanged

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.TelerikAlignHelper.ImageAlignToRelation(System.Drawing.ContentAlignment)
member.summary: Converts a value to the corresponding for image positioning.
member.param: The content alignment value representing where the image should be positioned.
member.returns: A value indicating the spatial relationship between image and text based on the specified alignment.

remarks.para: This method uses a pre-computed lookup table to quickly determine the appropriate text-image relationship based on how the image should be aligned. The conversion considers both horizontal and vertical positioning preferences.
This is useful when you have an image alignment preference and need to determine how the image should be positioned relative to text content for optimal layout.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.TelerikAlignHelper.TextAlignToRelation(System.Drawing.ContentAlignment)
member.summary: Converts a value to the corresponding for text positioning.
member.param: The content alignment value representing where the text should be positioned.
member.returns: A value indicating the spatial relationship between text and image based on the specified text alignment preference.

remarks.para: This method first determines what the image relationship would be for the given alignment using , then returns the opposite relationship to represent where the text should be positioned relative to the image.
This is useful when you have a text alignment preference and need to determine how the text should be positioned relative to image content for optimal layout.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.TelerikHelper.IsWindows8OrHigher

member.value: true if the operating system is Windows 10, Windows 11, or higher; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Telerik.WinControls.TelerikHelper.IsWindows7
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current operating system is exactly Windows 7.

member.name: M:Telerik.WinControls.TelerikHelper.ImageFromString(System.String)
member.summary: Converts a base64-encoded string to a System.Drawing.Image object.
member.param: The base64-encoded string representation of an image.
member.returns: A System.Drawing.Image object created from the encoded string, or null if the input string is null or empty.

remarks.para: This method decodes a base64 string and creates an Image object from the resulting byte array. It handles various pixel formats and applies appropriate transformations:

item.description: For 24bpp RGB images, creates a bitmap and makes magenta transparent
For GIF images, returns the image as-is
For other formats, converts to 32bpp ARGB format for better transparency support

remarks.para: The method properly disposes of intermediate resources to prevent memory leaks.

member.exception: Thrown when the input string is not a valid base64 string.
Thrown when the decoded data does not represent a valid image format.

member.param: The image to convert to a string representation.
member.returns: A base64-encoded string representing the image, or an empty string if the input image is null.

remarks.para: This method serializes an image to a base64 string that can be stored or transmitted as text. The method preserves the original image format when possible:

item.description: GIF images are saved in their original GIF format
Other image types are converted to PNG format for better quality and transparency support

remarks.para: The resulting string can be converted back to an image using the method. All intermediate resources are properly disposed to prevent memory leaks.
